flag.name: cdc_enable_replicate_intents
flag.meaning: Enable replication of intents before they've been committed.

flag.name: cdc_transaction_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Don't check for an aborted transaction unless its original write is lagging by this duration.

flag.name: cdc_read_rpc_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout used for CDC read rpc calls. Reads normally occur cross-cluster.

flag.name: cdc_state_checkpoint_update_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Rate at which CDC state's checkpoint is updated.

flag.name: cdc_write_rpc_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout used for CDC write rpc calls. Writes normally occur intra-cluster.

flag.name: cdc_ybclient_reactor_threads
flag.meaning: The number of reactor threads to be used for processing ybclient requests for CDC.

flag.name: certs_for_cdc_dir
flag.meaning: Directory that contains certificate authorities for CDC producer universes.

flag.name: enable_collect_cdc_metrics
flag.meaning: Enable collecting cdc metrics.

flag.name: update_metrics_interval_ms
flag.meaning: How often to update xDC cluster metrics.

flag.name: update_min_cdc_indices_interval_secs
flag.meaning: How often to read cdc_state table to get the minimum applied index for each tablet across all streams. This information is used to correctly keep log files that contain unapplied entries. This is also the rate at which a tablet's minimum replicated index across all streams is sent to the other peers in the configuration. If flag enable_log_retention_by_op_idx is disabled, this flag has no effect.

flag.name: cdc_state_table_num_tablets
flag.meaning: Number of tablets to use when creating the CDC state table.0 to use the same default num tablets as for regular tables.

flag.name: cdc_wal_retention_time_secs
flag.meaning: WAL retention time in seconds to be used for tables for which a CDC stream was created.

flag.name: enable_transaction_snapshots
flag.meaning: The flag enables usage of transaction aware snapshots.

flag.name: master_backup_svc_queue_length
flag.meaning: RPC queue length for master backup service

flag.name: cert_node_filename
flag.meaning: The file name that will be used in the names of the node certificates and keys. These files will be named : 'node.{cert_node_filename}.{key|crt}'. If this flag is not set, then --server_broadcast_addresses will be used if it is set, and if not, --rpc_bind_addresses will be used.

flag.name: certs_dir
flag.meaning: Directory that contains certificate authority, private key and certificates for this server. By default 'certs' subdir in data folder is used.

flag.name: certs_for_client_dir
flag.meaning: Directory that contains certificate authority, private key and certificates for this server that should be used for client to server communications. When empty, the same dir as for server to server communications is used.

flag.name: node_to_node_encryption_use_client_certificates
flag.meaning: Should client certificates be sent and verified for encrypted node to node communication.

flag.name: use_client_to_server_encryption
flag.meaning: Use client to server encryption

flag.name: use_node_to_node_encryption
flag.meaning: Use node to node encryption.

flag.name: async_replication_idle_delay_ms
flag.meaning: How long to delay between polling when we expect no data at the destination.

flag.name: async_replication_max_idle_wait
flag.meaning: Maximum number of consecutive empty GetChanges until the poller backs off to the idle interval, rather than immediately retrying.

flag.name: async_replication_polling_delay_ms
flag.meaning: How long to delay in ms between applying and polling.

flag.name: cdc_consumer_use_proxy_forwarding
flag.meaning: When enabled, read requests from the CDC Consumer that go to the wrong node are forwarded to the correct node by the Producer.

flag.name: replication_failure_delay_exponent
flag.meaning: Max number of failures (N) to use when calculating exponential backoff (2^N-1).

flag.name: ts_backup_svc_num_threads
flag.meaning: Number of RPC worker threads for the TS backup service

flag.name: ts_backup_svc_queue_length
flag.meaning: RPC queue length for the TS backup service

flag.name: cdc_force_remote_tserver
flag.meaning: Avoid local tserver apply optimization for CDC and force remote RPCs.

flag.name: TEST_twodc_write_hybrid_time
flag.meaning: Override external_hybrid_time with initialHybridTimeValue for testing. (For testing only!)

flag.name: cdc_max_apply_batch_num_records
flag.meaning: Max CDC write request batch num records. If set to 0, there is no max num records, which means batches will be limited only by size.

flag.name: cdc_max_apply_batch_size_bytes
flag.meaning: Max CDC write request batch size in kb. If 0, default to consensus_max_batch_size_bytes.

flag.name: TEST_force_master_leader_resolution
flag.meaning: Force master leader resolution even only one master is set. (For testing only!)

flag.name: detect_duplicates_for_retryable_requests
flag.meaning: Enable tracking of write requests that prevents the same write from being applied twice.

flag.name: forward_redis_requests
flag.meaning: If false, the redis op will not be served if it's not a local request. The op response will be set to the redis error '-MOVED partition_key 0.0.0.0:0'. This works with jedis which only looks at the MOVED part of the reply and ignores the rest. For now, if this flag is true, we will only attempt to read from leaders, so redis_allow_reads_from_followers will be ignored.

flag.name: TEST_combine_batcher_errors
flag.meaning: Whether combine errors into batcher status. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_simulate_tablet_lookup_does_not_match_partition_key_probability
flag.meaning: Probability for simulating the error that happens when a key is not in the key range of the resolved tablet's partition. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_assert_local_tablet_server_selected
flag.meaning: Verify that SelectTServer selected the local tablet server. Also verify that ReplicaSelection is equal to CLOSEST_REPLICA (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_assert_tablet_server_select_is_in_zone
flag.meaning: Verify that SelectTServer selected a talet server in the AZ specified by this flag. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_yb_num_total_tablets
flag.meaning: The total number of tablets per table when a table is created. (For testing only!)

flag.name: backfill_index_client_rpc_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout for BackfillIndex RPCs from client to master.

flag.name: client_suppress_created_logs
flag.meaning: Suppress 'Created table ...' messages

flag.name: yb_client_admin_operation_timeout_sec
flag.meaning: The number of seconds after which an admin operation should timeout.

flag.name: yb_client_num_reactors
flag.meaning: Number of reactor threads for the yb client to communicate with different tservers.

flag.name: TEST_force_master_lookup_all_tablets
flag.meaning: If set, force the client to go to the master for all tablet lookup instead of reading from cache. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_simulate_lookup_timeout_probability
flag.meaning: If set, mark an RPC as failed and force retry on the first attempt. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_verify_all_replicas_alive
flag.meaning: If set, when a RemoteTablet object is destroyed, we will verify that all its replicas are not marked as failed (For testing only!)

flag.name: max_concurrent_master_lookups
flag.meaning: Maximum number of concurrent tablet location lookups from YB client to master

flag.name: meta_cache_lookup_throttling_max_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Max delay between calls during lookup throttling.

flag.name: meta_cache_lookup_throttling_step_ms
flag.meaning: Step to increment delay between calls during lookup throttling.

flag.name: retry_failed_replica_ms
flag.meaning: Time in milliseconds to wait for before retrying a failed replica

flag.name: update_permissions_cache_msecs
flag.meaning: How often the roles' permissions cache should be updated. 0 means never update it

flag.name: client_read_write_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout for client read and write operations.

flag.name: max_num_tablets_for_table
flag.meaning: Max number of tablets that can be specified in a CREATE TABLE statement

flag.name: TEST_assert_failed_replicas_less_than
flag.meaning: If greater than 0, this process will crash if the number of failed replicas for a RemoteTabletServer is greater than the specified number. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_assert_local_op
flag.meaning: When set, we crash if we received an operation that cannot be served locally. (For testing only!)

flag.name: force_lookup_cache_refresh_secs
flag.meaning: When non-zero, specifies how often we send a GetTabletLocations request to the master leader to update the tablet replicas cache. This request is only sent if we are processing a ConsistentPrefix read.

flag.name: lookup_cache_refresh_secs
flag.meaning: When non-zero, specifies how often we send a GetTabletLocations request to the master leader to update the tablet replicas cache. This request is only sent if we are processing a ConsistentPrefix read and the RPC layer has determined that its view of the replicas is inconsistent with what the master has reported

flag.name: TEST_disable_proactive_txn_cleanup_on_abort
flag.meaning: Disable cleanup of intents in abort path. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_transaction_inject_flushed_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Inject delay before processing flushed operations by transaction. (For testing only!)

flag.name: transaction_disable_heartbeat_in_tests
flag.meaning: Disable heartbeat during test.

flag.name: transaction_heartbeat_usec
flag.meaning: Interval of transaction heartbeat in usec.

flag.name: transaction_manager_queue_limit
flag.meaning: Max number of tasks used by transaction manager

flag.name: transaction_manager_workers_limit
flag.meaning: Max number of workers used by transaction manager

flag.name: transaction_pool_cleanup_interval_ms
flag.meaning: How frequently we should cleanup transaction pool

flag.name: transaction_pool_reserve_factor
flag.meaning: During cleanup we will preserve number of transactions in pool that equals to average number or take requests during prepration multiplied by this factor

flag.name: redis_allow_reads_from_followers
flag.meaning: If true, the read will be served from the closest replica in the same AZ, which can be a follower.

flag.name: yb_system_namespace_readonly
flag.meaning: Set system keyspace read-only.

flag.name: wait_hybrid_time_sleep_interval_us
flag.meaning: Sleep interval in microseconds that will be used while waiting for specific hybrid time.

flag.name: yb_num_shards_per_tserver
flag.meaning: The default number of shards per table per tablet server when a table is created. If the value is -1, the system automatically determines the number of tablets.

flag.name: ysql_disable_index_backfill
flag.meaning: A kill switch to disable multi-stage backfill for YSQL indexes.

flag.name: ysql_num_shards_per_tserver
flag.meaning: The default number of shards per YSQL table per tablet server when a table is created.

flag.name: yql_max_value_size
flag.meaning: Maximum size of a value in the Yugabyte Query Layer

flag.name: transaction_rpc_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout used by transaction related RPCs in milliseconds.

flag.name: use_private_ip
flag.meaning: When to use private IP for connection. cloud - would use private IP if destination node is located in the same cloud. region - would use private IP if destination node is located in the same cloud and region. zone - would use private IP if destination node is located in the same cloud, region and zone.never - would never use private IP if broadcast address is specified.

flag.name: TEST_process_info_dir
flag.meaning: Directory where all postgres process will writes their PIDs and executable name (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_delay_removing_peer_with_failed_tablet_secs
flag.meaning: If greater than 0, Peer::ProcessResponse will sleep after receiving a response indicating that a tablet is in the FAILED state, and before marking this peer as failed. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_enable_remote_bootstrap
flag.meaning: Whether remote bootstrap will be initiated by the leader when it detects that a follower is out of date or does not have a tablet replica. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_fault_crash_on_leader_request_fraction
flag.meaning: Fraction of the time when the leader will crash just before sending an UpdateConsensus RPC. (For testing only!)

flag.name: consensus_rpc_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout used for all consensus internal RPC communications.

flag.name: max_wait_for_processresponse_before_closing_ms
flag.meaning: Maximum amount of time we will wait in Peer::Close() for Peer::ProcessResponse() to finish before returning proceding to close the Peer and return

flag.name: TEST_disallow_lmp_failures
flag.meaning: Whether we disallow PRECEDING_ENTRY_DIDNT_MATCH failures for non new peers. (For testing only!)

flag.name: cdc_checkpoint_opid_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Interval up to which CDC consumer's checkpoint is considered for retaining log cache.If we haven't received an updated checkpoint from CDC consumer within the interval specified by cdc_checkpoint_opid_interval, then log cache does not consider that consumer while determining which op IDs to evict.

flag.name: consensus_inject_latency_ms_in_notifications
flag.meaning: Injects a random sleep between 0 and this many milliseconds into asynchronous notifications from the consensus queue back to the consensus implementation.

flag.name: consensus_lagging_follower_threshold
flag.meaning: Number of retransmissions at tablet leader to mark a follower as lagging. -1 disables the feature.

flag.name: consensus_max_batch_size_bytes
flag.meaning: The maximum per-tablet RPC batch size when updating peers.

flag.name: enable_consensus_exponential_backoff
flag.meaning: Whether exponential backoff based on number of retransmissions at tablet leader for number of entries to replicate to lagging follower is enabled.

flag.name: follower_unavailable_considered_failed_sec
flag.meaning: Seconds that a leader is unable to successfully heartbeat to a follower after which the follower is considered to be failed and evicted from the config.

flag.name: TEST_log_consider_all_ops_safe
flag.meaning: If true, we consider all operations to be safe and will not waitfor the opId to apply to the local log. i.e. WaitForSafeOpIdToApply becomes a noop. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_log_fault_after_segment_allocation_min_replicate_index
flag.meaning: Fault of segment allocation when min replicate index is at least specified. 0 to disable. (For testing only!)

flag.name: consensus_log_scoped_watch_delay_append_threshold_ms
flag.meaning: If consensus log append takes longer than this, the kernel watchdog will print out a stack trace.

flag.name: consensus_log_scoped_watch_delay_callback_threshold_ms
flag.meaning: If calling consensus log callback(s) take longer than this, the kernel watchdog will print out a stack trace.

flag.name: log_inject_append_latency_ms_max
flag.meaning: The maximum latency to inject before the log append operation.

flag.name: log_inject_latency
flag.meaning: If true, injects artificial latency in log sync operations. Advanced option. Use at your own risk -- has a negative effect on performance for obvious reasons!

flag.name: log_inject_latency_ms_mean
flag.meaning: The number of milliseconds of latency to inject, on average. Only takes effect if --log_inject_latency is true

flag.name: log_inject_latency_ms_stddev
flag.meaning: The standard deviation of latency to inject in before log sync operations. Only takes effect if --log_inject_latency is true

flag.name: log_min_seconds_to_retain
flag.meaning: The minimum number of seconds for which to keep log segments to keep at all times, regardless of what is required for durability. Logs may be still retained for a longer amount of time if they are necessary for correct restart. This should be set long enough such that a tablet server which has temporarily failed can be restarted within the given time period. If a server is down for longer than this amount of time, it is possible that its tablets will be re-replicated on other machines.

flag.name: log_min_segments_to_retain
flag.meaning: The minimum number of past log segments to keep at all times, regardless of what is required for durability. Must be at least 1.

flag.name: taskstream_queue_max_size
flag.meaning: Maximum number of operations waiting in the taskstream queue.

flag.name: taskstream_queue_max_wait_ms
flag.meaning: Maximum time in ms to wait for items in the taskstream queue to arrive.

flag.name: wait_for_safe_op_id_to_apply_default_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout used by WaitForSafeOpIdToApply when it was not specified by caller.

flag.name: TEST_log_cache_skip_eviction
flag.meaning: Don't evict log entries in tests. (For testing only!)

flag.name: global_log_cache_size_limit_mb
flag.meaning: Server-wide version of 'log_cache_size_limit_mb'. The total memory used for caching log entries across all tablets is kept under this threshold.

flag.name: log_cache_size_limit_mb
flag.meaning: The total per-tablet size of consensus entries which may be kept in memory. The log cache attempts to keep all entries which have not yet been replicated to all followers in memory, but if the total size of those entries exceeds this limit within an individual tablet, the oldest will be evicted.

flag.name: TEST_record_segments_violate_max_time_policy
flag.meaning: If set, everytime GetSegmentPrefixNotIncluding runs, segments that violate the max time policy will be appended to LogReader::segments_violate_max_time_policy_. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_record_segments_violate_min_space_policy
flag.meaning: If set, everytime GetSegmentPrefixNotIncluding runs, segments that violate the max time policy will be appended to LogReader::segments_violate_min_space_policy_. (For testing only!)

flag.name: enable_log_retention_by_op_idx
flag.meaning: If true, logs will be retained based on an op id passed by the cdc service

flag.name: log_max_seconds_to_retain
flag.meaning: Log files that are older will be deleted even if they contain cdc unreplicated entries. If 0, this flag will be ignored. This flag is ignored if a log segment contains entries that haven't beenflushed to RocksDB.

flag.name: log_stop_retaining_min_disk_mb
flag.meaning: Stop retaining logs if the space available for the logs falls below this limit. This flag is ignored if a log segment contains unflushed entries.

flag.name: bytes_durable_wal_write_mb
flag.meaning: Amount of data in MB after which the Log/WAL should explicitly call fsync(). If 0 fsysnc() is not called.

flag.name: durable_wal_write
flag.meaning: Whether the Log/WAL should explicitly call fsync() after each write.

flag.name: initial_log_segment_size_bytes
flag.meaning: The maximum segment size we want for a new WAL segment, in bytes. This value keeps doubling (for each subsequent WAL segment) till it gets to the maximum configured segment size (log_segment_size_bytes or log_segment_size_mb).

flag.name: interval_durable_wal_write_ms
flag.meaning: Interval in ms after which the Log/WAL should explicitly call fsync(). If 0 fsysnc() is not called.

flag.name: log_async_preallocate_segments
flag.meaning: Whether the WAL segments preallocation should happen asynchronously

flag.name: log_preallocate_segments
flag.meaning: Whether the WAL should preallocate the entire segment before writing to it

flag.name: log_segment_size_bytes
flag.meaning: The default segment size for log roll-overs, in bytes. If 0 then log_segment_size_mb is used.

flag.name: log_segment_size_mb
flag.meaning: The default segment size for log roll-overs, in MB

flag.name: require_durable_wal_write
flag.meaning: Whether durable WAL write is required.In case you cannot write using O_DIRECT in WAL and data directories and this flag is set truethe system will deliberately crash with the appropriate error. If this flag is set false, the system will soft downgrade the durable_wal_write flag.

flag.name: TEST_do_not_start_election_test_only
flag.meaning: Do not start election even if leader failure is detected. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_follower_fail_all_prepare
flag.meaning: Whether a follower will fail preparing all operations. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_follower_reject_update_consensus_requests
flag.meaning: Whether a follower will return an error for all UpdateConsensus() requests. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_follower_reject_update_consensus_requests_seconds
flag.meaning: Whether a follower will return an error for all UpdateConsensus() requests for the first TEST_follower_reject_update_consensus_requests_seconds seconds after the Consensus objet is created. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_inject_delay_leader_change_role_append_secs
flag.meaning: Amount of time to delay leader from sending replicate of change role. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_log_change_config_every_n
flag.meaning: How often to log change config information. Used to reduce the number of lines being printed for change config requests when a test simulates a failure that would generate a log of these requests. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_pause_update_majority_replicated
flag.meaning: Pause RaftConsensus::UpdateMajorityReplicated. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_pause_update_replica
flag.meaning: Pause RaftConsensus::UpdateReplica processing before snoozing failure detector. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_return_error_on_change_config
flag.meaning: Fraction of the time when ChangeConfig will return an error. (For testing only!)

flag.name: after_stepdown_delay_election_multiplier
flag.meaning: After a peer steps down as a leader, the factor with which to multiply leader_failure_max_missed_heartbeat_periods to get the delay time before starting a new election.

flag.name: enable_leader_failure_detection
flag.meaning: Whether to enable failure detection of tablet leaders. If enabled, attempts will be made to elect a follower as a new leader when the leader is detected to have failed.

flag.name: enable_lease_revocation
flag.meaning: Enables lease revocation mechanism

flag.name: evict_failed_followers
flag.meaning: Whether to evict followers from the Raft config that have fallen too far behind the leader's log to catch up normally or have been unreachable by the leader for longer than follower_unavailable_considered_failed_sec

flag.name: ht_lease_duration_ms
flag.meaning: Hybrid time leader lease duration. A leader keeps establishing a new lease or extending the existing one with every UpdateConsensus. A new server is not allowed to add entries to RAFT log until a lease of the old leader is expired. 0 to disable.

flag.name: leader_failure_exp_backoff_max_delta_ms
flag.meaning: Maximum time to sleep in between leader election retries, in addition to the regular timeout. When leader election fails the interval in between retries increases exponentially, up to this value.

flag.name: leader_failure_max_missed_heartbeat_periods
flag.meaning: Maximum heartbeat periods that the leader can fail to heartbeat in before we consider the leader to be failed. The total failure timeout in milliseconds is raft_heartbeat_interval_ms times leader_failure_max_missed_heartbeat_periods. The value passed to this flag may be fractional.

flag.name: leader_lease_duration_ms
flag.meaning: Leader lease duration. A leader keeps establishing a new lease or extending the existing one with every UpdateConsensus. A new server is not allowed to serve as a leader (i.e. serve up-to-date read requests or acknowledge write requests) until a lease of this duration has definitely expired on the old leader's side.

flag.name: min_leader_stepdown_retry_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Minimum amount of time between successive attempts to perform the leader stepdown for the same combination of tablet and intended (target) leader. This is needed to avoid infinite leader stepdown loops when the current leader never has a chance to update the intended leader with its latest records.

flag.name: protege_synchronization_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout to synchronize protege before performing step down. 0 to disable synchronization.

flag.name: quick_leader_election_on_create
flag.meaning: Do we trigger quick leader elections on table creation.

flag.name: raft_disallow_concurrent_outstanding_report_failure_tasks
flag.meaning: If true, only submit a new report failure task if there is not one outstanding.

flag.name: raft_heartbeat_interval_ms
flag.meaning: The heartbeat interval for Raft replication. The leader produces heartbeats to followers at this interval. The followers expect a heartbeat at this interval and consider a leader to have failed if it misses several in a row.

flag.name: stepdown_disable_graceful_transition
flag.meaning: During a leader stepdown, disable graceful leadership transfer to an up to date peer

flag.name: temporary_disable_preelections_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: If some of nodes does not support preelections, then we disable them for this amount of time.

flag.name: use_preelection
flag.meaning: Whether to use pre election, before doing actual election.

flag.name: inject_delay_commit_pre_voter_to_voter_secs
flag.meaning: Amount of time to delay commit of a PRE_VOTER to VOTER transition. To be used for unit testing purposes only.

flag.name: retryable_request_range_time_limit_secs
flag.meaning: Max delta in time for single op id range.

flag.name: retryable_request_timeout_secs
flag.meaning: Amount of time to keep write request in index, to prevent duplicate writes.

flag.name: TEST_pause_write_apply_after_if
flag.meaning: Pause application of QLWriteOperation after evaluating if condition. (For testing only!)

flag.name: ycql_consistent_transactional_paging
flag.meaning: Whether to enforce consistency of data returned for second page and beyond for YCQL queries on transactional tables. If true, read restart errors could be returned to prevent inconsistency. If false, no read restart errors are returned but the data may be stale. The latter is preferable for long scans. The data returned for the first page of results is never stale regardless of this flag.

flag.name: ycql_disable_index_updating_optimization
flag.meaning: If true all secondary indexes must be updated even if the update does not change the index data.

flag.name: TEST_tserver_timeout
flag.meaning: Sleep past the deadline to test tserver query expiration (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_docdb_sort_weak_intents_in_tests
flag.meaning: Sort weak intents to make their order deterministic. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_fail_on_replicated_batch_idx_set_in_txn_record
flag.meaning: Fail when a set of replicated batch indexes is found in txn record. (For testing only!)

flag.name: enable_transaction_sealing
flag.meaning: Whether transaction sealing is enabled.

flag.name: txn_max_apply_batch_records
flag.meaning: Max number of apply records allowed in single RocksDB batch. When a transaction's data in one tablet does not fit into specified number of records, it will be applied using multiple RocksDB write batches.

flag.name: aborted_intent_cleanup_max_batch_size
flag.meaning: Number of transactions to collect for possible cleanup.

flag.name: aborted_intent_cleanup_ms
flag.meaning: Duration in ms after which to check if a transaction is aborted.

flag.name: external_intent_cleanup_secs
flag.meaning: Duration in secs after which to cleanup external intents.

flag.name: intents_compaction_filter_max_errors_to_log
flag.meaning: Maximum number of errors to log for life cycle of the intents compcation filter.

flag.name: db_block_size_bytes
flag.meaning: Size of RocksDB data block (in bytes).

flag.name: db_filter_block_size_bytes
flag.meaning: Size of RocksDB filter block (in bytes).

flag.name: db_index_block_size_bytes
flag.meaning: Size of RocksDB index block (in bytes).

flag.name: db_min_keys_per_index_block
flag.meaning: Minimum number of keys per index block.

flag.name: db_write_buffer_size
flag.meaning: Size of RocksDB write buffer (in bytes). -1 to use default.

flag.name: enable_ondisk_compression
flag.meaning: Determines whether SSTable compression is enabled or not.

flag.name: initial_seqno
flag.meaning: Initial seqno for new RocksDB instances.

flag.name: max_nexts_to_avoid_seek
flag.meaning: The number of next calls to try before doing resorting to do a rocksdb seek.

flag.name: memstore_size_mb
flag.meaning: Max size (in mb) of the memstore, before needing to flush.

flag.name: num_reserved_small_compaction_threads
flag.meaning: Number of reserved small compaction threads. It allows splitting small vs. large compactions.

flag.name: priority_thread_pool_size
flag.meaning: Max running workers in compaction thread pool. If -1 and max_background_compactions is specified - use max_background_compactions. If -1 and max_background_compactions is not specified - use sqrt(num_cpus).

flag.name: rocksdb_base_background_compactions
flag.meaning: Number threads to do background compactions.

flag.name: rocksdb_compact_flush_rate_limit_bytes_per_sec
flag.meaning: Use to control write rate of flush and compaction.

flag.name: rocksdb_compaction_measure_io_stats
flag.meaning: Measure stats for rocksdb compactions.

flag.name: rocksdb_compaction_size_threshold_bytes
flag.meaning: Threshold beyond which compaction is considered large.

flag.name: rocksdb_disable_compactions
flag.meaning: Disable rocksdb compactions.

flag.name: rocksdb_level0_file_num_compaction_trigger
flag.meaning: Number of files to trigger level-0 compaction. -1 if compaction should not be triggered by number of files at all.

flag.name: rocksdb_level0_slowdown_writes_trigger
flag.meaning: The number of files above which writes are slowed down.

flag.name: rocksdb_level0_stop_writes_trigger
flag.meaning: The number of files above which compactions are stopped.

flag.name: rocksdb_max_background_compactions
flag.meaning: Increased number of threads to do background compactions (used when compactions need to catch up.)

flag.name: rocksdb_max_background_flushes
flag.meaning: Number threads to do background flushes.

flag.name: rocksdb_max_file_size_for_compaction
flag.meaning: Maximal allowed file size to participate in RocksDB compaction. 0 - unlimited.

flag.name: rocksdb_max_write_buffer_number
flag.meaning: Maximum number of write buffers that are built up in memory.

flag.name: rocksdb_universal_compaction_always_include_size_threshold
flag.meaning: Always include files of smaller or equal size in a compaction.

flag.name: rocksdb_universal_compaction_min_merge_width
flag.meaning: The minimum number of files in a single compaction run.

flag.name: rocksdb_universal_compaction_size_ratio
flag.meaning: The percentage upto which files that are larger are include in a compaction.

flag.name: trace_docdb_calls
flag.meaning: Whether we should trace calls into the docdb.

flag.name: use_docdb_aware_bloom_filter
flag.meaning: Whether to use the DocDbAwareFilterPolicy for both bloom storage and seeks.

flag.name: use_multi_level_index
flag.meaning: Whether to use multi-level data index.

flag.name: TEST_transaction_allow_rerequest_status
flag.meaning: Allow rerequest transaction status when try again is received.

flag.name: TEST_slowdown_pgsql_aggregate_read_ms
flag.meaning: If set > 0, slows down the response to pgsql aggregate read by this amount. (For testing only!)

flag.name: pgsql_consistent_transactional_paging
flag.meaning: Whether to enforce consistency of data returned for second page and beyond for YSQL queries on transactional tables. If true, read restart errors could be returned to prevent inconsistency. If false, no read restart errors are returned but the data may be stale. The latter is preferable for long scans. The data returned for the first page of results is never stale regardless of this flag.

flag.name: ysql_scan_timeout_multiplier
flag.meaning: YSQL read scan timeout multipler of retryable_rpc_single_call_timeout_ms.

flag.name: emulate_redis_responses
flag.meaning: If emulate_redis_responses is false, we hope to get slightly better performance by just returning OK for commands that might require us to read additional records viz. SADD, HSET, and HDEL. If emulate_redis_responses is true, we read the required records to compute the response as specified by the official Redis API documentation. https://redis.io/commands

flag.name: TEST_simulate_fs_create_failure
flag.meaning: Simulate failure during initial creation of fs during the first time process creation. (For testing only!)

flag.name: enable_data_block_fsync
flag.meaning: Whether to enable fsync() of data blocks, metadata, and their parent directories. Disabling this flag may cause data loss in the event of a system crash.

flag.name: fs_wal_dirs
flag.meaning: Comma-separated list of directories for write-ahead logs. This is an optional argument. If this is not specified, fs_data_dirs is used for write-ahead logs also and that's a reasonable default for most use cases.

flag.name: instance_uuid_override
flag.meaning: When creating local instance metadata (for master or tserver) in an empty data directory, use this UUID instead of randomly-generated one. Can be used to replace a node that had its disk wiped in some scenarios.

flag.name: num_cpus
flag.meaning: Number of CPU cores used in calculations

flag.name: TEST_slowdown_master_async_rpc_tasks_by_ms
flag.meaning: For testing purposes, slow down the run method to take longer. (For testing only!)

flag.name: retrying_ts_rpc_max_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Maximum delay between successive attempts to contact an unresponsive tablet server

flag.name: unresponsive_ts_rpc_retry_limit
flag.meaning: After this number of retries (or unresponsive_ts_rpc_timeout_ms expires, whichever happens first), the master will stop attempting to contact a tablet server in order to perform operations such as deleting a tablet.

flag.name: unresponsive_ts_rpc_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: After this amount of time (or after we have retried unresponsive_ts_rpc_retry_limit times, whichever happens first), the master will stop attempting to contact a tablet server in order to perform operations such as deleting a tablet.

flag.name: TEST_slowdown_backfill_alter_table_rpcs_ms
flag.meaning: Slows down the send alter table rpc's so that the master may be stopped between different phases. (For testing only!)

flag.name: index_backfill_rpc_max_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Maximum delay before retrying a backfill tablet chunk request during index creation.

flag.name: index_backfill_rpc_max_retries
flag.meaning: Number of times to retry backfilling a tablet chunk during index creation.

flag.name: index_backfill_rpc_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout used by the master when attempting to backfill a tablet during index creation.

flag.name: index_backfill_wait_for_alter_table_completion_ms
flag.meaning: Delay before retrying to see if an in-progress alter table has completed, during index backfill.

flag.name: ysql_index_backfill_rpc_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout used by the master when attempting to backfill a YSQL tablet during index creation.

flag.name: callhome_collection_level
flag.meaning: Level of details sent by callhome

flag.name: callhome_enabled
flag.meaning: Enables callhome feature that sends analytics data to yugabyte

flag.name: callhome_interval_secs
flag.meaning: How often to run callhome

flag.name: callhome_tag
flag.meaning: Tag to be inserted in the json sent to FLAGS_callhome_url. This tag is used by itest to specify that the data generated by callhome should be discarded by the receiver.

flag.name: callhome_url
flag.meaning: URL of callhome server

flag.name: master_ignore_deleted_on_load
flag.meaning: Whether the Master should ignore deleted tables & tablets on restart. This reduces failover time at the expense of garbage data.

flag.name: TEST_catalog_manager_simulate_system_table_create_failure
flag.meaning: This is only used in tests to simulate a failure where the table information is persisted in syscatalog, but the tablet information is not yet persisted and there is a failure. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_create_table_leader_hint_min_lexicographic
flag.meaning: Whether the Master should hint replica with smallest lexicographic rank for each tablet as leader initially on tablet creation. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_hang_on_namespace_transition
flag.meaning: Used in tests to simulate a lapse between issuing a namespace op and final processing. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_inject_latency_during_remote_bootstrap_secs
flag.meaning: Number of seconds to sleep during a remote bootstrap. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_inject_latency_during_tablet_report_ms
flag.meaning: Number of milliseconds to sleep during the processing of a tablet batch. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_return_error_if_namespace_not_found
flag.meaning: Return an error from ListTables if a namespace id is not found in the map (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_simulate_crash_after_table_marked_deleting
flag.meaning: Crash yb-master after table's state is set to DELETING. This skips tablets deletion. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_simulate_slow_system_tablet_bootstrap_secs
flag.meaning: Simulates a slow tablet bootstrap by adding a sleep before system tablet init. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_simulate_slow_table_create_secs
flag.meaning: Simulates a slow table creation by sleeping after the table has been added to memory. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_tablegroup_master_only
flag.meaning: This is only for MasterTest to be able to test tablegroups without the transaction status table being created. (For testing only!)

flag.name: blacklist_progress_initial_delay_secs
flag.meaning: When a master leader failsover, the time until which the progress of load movement off the blacklisted tservers is reported as 0. This initial delay gives sufficient time for heartbeats so that we don't report a premature incorrect completion.

flag.name: catalog_manager_check_ts_count_for_create_table
flag.meaning: Whether the master should ensure that there are enough live tablet servers to satisfy the provided replication count before allowing a table to be created.

flag.name: catalog_manager_inject_latency_in_delete_table_ms
flag.meaning: Number of milliseconds that the master will sleep in DeleteTable.

flag.name: catalog_manager_report_batch_size
flag.meaning: The max number of tablets evaluated in the heartbeat as a single SysCatalog update.

flag.name: catalog_manager_wait_for_new_tablets_to_elect_leader
flag.meaning: Whether the catalog manager should wait for a newly created tablet to elect a leader before considering it successfully created. This is disabled in some tests where we explicitly manage leader election.

flag.name: cluster_uuid
flag.meaning: Cluster UUID to be used by this cluster

flag.name: disable_index_backfill
flag.meaning: A kill switch to disable multi-stage backfill for YCQL indexes.

flag.name: disable_index_backfill_for_non_txn_tables
flag.meaning: A kill switch to disable multi-stage backfill for user encorced YCQL indexes. Note that setting this to true may cause the create index flow to be slow. This is needed to ensure the safety of the index backfill process. See also index_backfill_upperbound_for_user_enforced_txn_duration_ms

flag.name: enable_register_ts_from_raft
flag.meaning: Whether to register a tserver from the consensus information of a reported tablet.

flag.name: enable_transactional_ddl_gc
flag.meaning: A kill switch for transactional DDL GC. Temporary safety measure.

flag.name: heartbeat_safe_deadline_ratio
flag.meaning: When the heartbeat deadline has this percentage of time remaining, the master should halt tablet report processing so it can respond in time.

flag.name: hide_pg_catalog_table_creation_logs
flag.meaning: Whether to hide detailed log messages for PostgreSQL catalog table creation. This cuts down test logs significantly.

flag.name: master_drop_table_after_task_response
flag.meaning: Mark a table as DELETED as soon as we get all the responses from all the TS.

flag.name: master_enable_metrics_snapshotter
flag.meaning: Should metrics snapshotter be enabled

flag.name: master_failover_catchup_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Amount of time to give a newly-elected leader master to load the previous master's metadata and become active. If this time is exceeded, the node crashes.

flag.name: master_ignore_stale_cstate
flag.meaning: Whether Master processes the raft config when the version is lower.

flag.name: master_tombstone_evicted_tablet_replicas
flag.meaning: Whether the Master should tombstone (delete) tablet replicas that are no longer part of the latest reported raft config.

flag.name: master_ts_rpc_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout used for the Master->TS async rpc calls.

flag.name: max_create_tablets_per_ts
flag.meaning: The number of tablets per TS that can be requested for a new table.

flag.name: metrics_snapshots_table_num_tablets
flag.meaning: Number of tablets to use when creating the metrics snapshots table.0 to use the same default num tablets as for regular tables.

flag.name: partitions_vtable_cache_refresh_secs
flag.meaning: Amount of time to wait before refreshing the system.partitions cached vtable.

flag.name: replication_factor
flag.meaning: Default number of replicas for tables that do not have the num_replicas set.

flag.name: tablet_creation_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout used by the master when attempting to create tablet replicas during table creation.

flag.name: tablet_split_limit_per_table
flag.meaning: Limit of the number of tablets per table for tablet splitting. Limitation is disabled if this value is set to 0.

flag.name: transaction_table_num_tablets
flag.meaning: Number of tablets to use when creating the transaction status table.0 to use the same default num tablets as for regular tables.

flag.name: use_create_table_leader_hint
flag.meaning: Whether the Master should hint which replica for each tablet should be leader initially on tablet creation.

flag.name: ysql_backfill_is_create_table_done_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Time to wait after IsCreateTableDone for an index using online schema migration finds the index in the master index map.

flag.name: catalog_manager_bg_task_wait_ms
flag.meaning: Amount of time the catalog manager background task thread waits between runs

flag.name: load_balancer_initial_delay_secs
flag.meaning: Amount of time to wait between becoming master leader and enabling the load balancer.

flag.name: balancer_load_max_standard_deviation
flag.meaning: The standard deviation among the tserver load, above which that distribution is considered not balanced.

flag.name: TEST_load_balancer_handle_under_replicated_tablets_only
flag.meaning: Limit the functionality of the load balancer during tests so tests can make progress (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_load_balancer_wait_after_count_pending_tasks_ms
flag.meaning: For testing purposes, number of milliseconds to wait after counting and finding pending tasks. (For testing only!)

flag.name: enable_global_load_balancing
flag.meaning: Choose whether to allow the load balancer to make moves that strictly only balance global load. Note that global balancing only occurs after all tables are balanced.

flag.name: enable_load_balancing
flag.meaning: Choose whether to enable the load balancing algorithm, to move tablets around.

flag.name: leader_balance_threshold
flag.meaning: Number of leaders per each tablet server to balance below. If this is configured to 0 (the default), the leaders will be balanced optimally at extra cost.

flag.name: leader_balance_unresponsive_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: The period of time that a master can go without receiving a heartbeat from a tablet server before considering it unresponsive. Unresponsive servers are excluded from leader balancing.

flag.name: load_balancer_max_concurrent_adds
flag.meaning: Maximum number of tablet peer replicas to add in any one run of the load balancer.

flag.name: load_balancer_max_concurrent_moves
flag.meaning: Maximum number of tablet leaders on tablet servers (across the cluster) to move in any one run of the load balancer.

flag.name: load_balancer_max_concurrent_moves_per_table
flag.meaning: Maximum number of tablet leaders per table to move in any one run of the load balancer. The maximum number of tablet leader moves across the cluster is still limited by the flag load_balancer_max_concurrent_moves. This flag is meant to prevent a single table from using all of the leader moves quota and starving other tables.

flag.name: load_balancer_max_concurrent_removals
flag.meaning: Maximum number of over-replicated tablet peer removals to do in any one run of the load balancer.

flag.name: load_balancer_max_concurrent_tablet_remote_bootstraps
flag.meaning: Maximum number of tablets being remote bootstrapped across the cluster.

flag.name: load_balancer_max_concurrent_tablet_remote_bootstraps_per_table
flag.meaning: Maximum number of tablets being remote bootstrapped for any table. The maximum number of remote bootstraps across the cluster is still limited by the flag load_balancer_max_concurrent_tablet_remote_bootstraps. This flag is meant to prevent a single table use all the available remote bootstrap sessions and starving other tables.

flag.name: load_balancer_max_over_replicated_tablets
flag.meaning: Maximum number of running tablet replicas that are allowed to be over the configured replication factor.

flag.name: load_balancer_num_idle_runs
flag.meaning: Number of idle runs of load balancer to deem it idle.

flag.name: load_balancer_skip_leader_as_remove_victim
flag.meaning: Should the LB skip a leader as a possible remove candidate.

flag.name: transaction_tables_use_preferred_zones
flag.meaning: Choose whether transaction tablet leaders respect preferred zones.

flag.name: hide_dead_node_threshold_mins
flag.meaning: After this many minutes of no heartbeat from a node, hide it from the UI (we presume it has been removed from the cluster). If -1, this flag is ignored and node is never hidden from the UI

flag.name: TEST_master_extra_list_host_port
flag.meaning: Additional host port used in list masters (For testing only!)

flag.name: master_consensus_svc_num_threads
flag.meaning: Number of RPC threads for the master consensus service

flag.name: master_consensus_svc_queue_length
flag.meaning: RPC queue length for master consensus service

flag.name: master_remote_bootstrap_svc_num_threads
flag.meaning: Number of RPC threads for the master remote bootstrap service

flag.name: master_remote_bootstrap_svc_queue_length
flag.meaning: RPC queue length for master remote bootstrap service

flag.name: master_rpc_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout for retrieving master registration over RPC.

flag.name: master_svc_num_threads
flag.meaning: Number of RPC worker threads to run for the master service

flag.name: master_svc_queue_length
flag.meaning: RPC queue length for master service

flag.name: master_tserver_svc_num_threads
flag.meaning: Number of RPC worker threads to run for the master tserver service

flag.name: master_tserver_svc_queue_length
flag.meaning: RPC queue length for master tserver service

flag.name: create_cluster
flag.meaning: (DEPRECATED). This flag was earlier used to distinguish if the master process is being started to create a cluster or if this just a restart.

flag.name: master_addresses
flag.meaning: Comma-separated list of the host/port RPC addresses of the peer masters. This is needed for initial cluster create, and is recreated from persisted metadata on master restart.This flag also defaults to empty, which is overloaded to be able to either: a) start a non-distributed mode master if local instance file is not present. b) allow for a master to be restarted gracefully and get its peer list from the local cmeta file of the last committed config, if local instance file is present.

flag.name: master_replication_factor
flag.meaning: Number of master replicas. By default it is detected based on master_addresses option, but could be specified explicitly together with passing one or more master service domain name and port through master_addresses for masters auto-discovery when running on Kubernetes.

flag.name: master_leader_rpc_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Number of milliseconds that the tserver will keep querying for master leader beforeselecting a follower.

flag.name: TEST_master_fail_transactional_tablet_lookups
flag.meaning: Whether to fail all lookup requests to transactional table. (For testing only!)

flag.name: master_inject_latency_on_tablet_lookups_ms
flag.meaning: Number of milliseconds that the master will sleep before responding to requests for tablet locations.

flag.name: master_slow_get_registration_probability
flag.meaning: Probability of injecting delay in GetMasterRegistration.

flag.name: tablet_report_limit
flag.meaning: Max Number of tablets to report during a single heartbeat. If this is set to INT32_MAX, then heartbeat will report all dirty tablets.

flag.name: tablet_split_size_threshold_bytes
flag.meaning: Threshold on tablet size after which tablet should be split. Automated splitting is disabled if this value is set to 0

flag.name: snapshot_coordinator_cleanup_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Delay for snapshot cleanup after deletion.

flag.name: snapshot_coordinator_poll_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Poll interval for snapshot coordinator in milliseconds.

flag.name: TEST_ysql_catalog_write_rejection_percentage
flag.meaning: Reject specified percentage of writes to the YSQL catalog tables. (For testing only!)

flag.name: master_log_lock_warning_ms
flag.meaning: Print warnings if lock is held for longer than this amount of time.

flag.name: TEST_sys_catalog_write_rejection_percentage
flag.meaning: Reject specified percentage of sys catalog writes. (For testing only!)

flag.name: copy_tables_batch_bytes
flag.meaning: Max bytes per batch for copy pg sql tables

flag.name: notify_peer_of_removal_from_cluster
flag.meaning: Notify a peer after it has been removed from the cluster.

flag.name: sys_catalog_write_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout for writes into system catalog

flag.name: create_initial_sys_catalog_snapshot
flag.meaning: Run initdb and create an initial sys catalog data snapshot

flag.name: enable_ysql
flag.meaning: Enable YSQL on cluster. This will initialize sys catalog tablet from a pre-existing snapshot and start YSQL proxy. Only takes effect if --initial_sys_catalog_snapshot_path is specified or can be auto-detected.

flag.name: initial_sys_catalog_snapshot_path
flag.meaning: If this is specified, system catalog RocksDB is checkpointed at this location after initdb is done.

flag.name: master_auto_run_initdb
flag.meaning: Automatically run initdb on master leader initialization

flag.name: use_initial_sys_catalog_snapshot
flag.meaning: DEPRECATED: use --enable_ysql instead. Initialize sys catalog tablet from a pre-existing snapshot instead of running initdb. Only takes effect if --initial_sys_catalog_snapshot_path is specified or can be auto-detected.

flag.name: long_term_tasks_tracker_keep_time_multiplier
flag.meaning: How long we should keep long-term tasks before cleaning them up, as a multiple of the load balancer interval (catalog_manager_bg_task_wait_ms).

flag.name: tasks_tracker_keep_time_multiplier
flag.meaning: How long we should keep tasks before cleaning them up, as a multiple of the load balancer interval (catalog_manager_bg_task_wait_ms).

flag.name: tasks_tracker_num_long_term_tasks
flag.meaning: Number of most recent tasks to track for displaying in utilities UI.

flag.name: tasks_tracker_num_tasks
flag.meaning: Number of most recent tasks to track for displaying in utilities UI.

flag.name: tserver_unresponsive_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: The period of time that a Master can go without receiving a heartbeat from a tablet server before considering it unresponsive. Unresponsive servers are not selected when assigning replicas during table creation or re-replication.

flag.name: use_cache_for_partitions_vtable
flag.meaning: Whether we should use caching for system.partitions table.

flag.name: ysql_transaction_bg_task_wait_ms
flag.meaning: Amount of time the catalog manager background task thread waits between runs

flag.name: memstore_arena_size_kb
flag.meaning: Size of each arena allocation for the memstore

flag.name: aggressive_compaction_for_read_amp
flag.meaning: Determines if we should compact aggressively to reduce read amplification based on number of files alone, without regards to relative sizes of the SSTable files.

flag.name: TEST_max_write_waiters
flag.meaning: Max allowed number of write waiters per RocksDB instance in tests. (For testing only!)

flag.name: compaction_priority_start_bound
flag.meaning: Compaction task of DB that has number of SST files less than specified will have priority 0.

flag.name: compaction_priority_step_size
flag.meaning: Compaction task of DB that has number of SST files greater that compaction_priority_start_bound will get 1 extra priority per every compaction_priority_step_size files.

flag.name: dump_dbimpl_info
flag.meaning: Dump RocksDB info during constructor.

flag.name: fault_crash_after_rocksdb_flush
flag.meaning: Fraction of time to crash right after a successful RocksDB flush in tests.

flag.name: flush_rocksdb_on_shutdown
flag.meaning: Safely flush RocksDB when instance is destroyed, disabled for crash tests.

flag.name: rocksdb_use_logging_iterator
flag.meaning: Wrap newly created RocksDB iterators in a logging wrapper

flag.name: small_compaction_extra_priority
flag.meaning: Small compaction will get small_compaction_extra_priority extra priority.

flag.name: use_priority_thread_pool_for_compactions
flag.meaning: When true priority thread pool will be used for compactions, otherwise Env thread pool with Priority::LOW will be used.

flag.name: use_priority_thread_pool_for_flushes
flag.meaning: When true priority thread pool will be used for flushes, otherwise Env thread pool with Priority::HIGH will be used.

flag.name: TEST_rocksdb_crash_on_flush
flag.meaning: When set, memtable flush in rocksdb crashes. (For testing only!)

flag.name: rocksdb_nothing_in_memtable_to_flush_sleep_ms
flag.meaning: Used for a temporary workaround for http://bit.ly/ybissue437. How long to wait (ms) in case we could not flush any memtables, usually due to filters preventing us from doing so.

flag.name: use_per_file_metadata_for_flushed_frontier
flag.meaning: Allows taking per-file metadata in version edits into account when computing the flushed frontier.

flag.name: TEST_allow_stop_writes
flag.meaning: Whether it is allowed to stop writes in tests. (For testing only!)

flag.name: verify_encrypted_meta_block_checksums
flag.meaning: Whether to verify checksums for meta blocks of encrypted SSTables.

flag.name: cache_overflow_single_touch
flag.meaning: Whether to enable overflow of single touch cache into the multi touch cache allocation

flag.name: cache_single_touch_ratio
flag.meaning: Fraction of the cache dedicated to single-touch items

flag.name: allow_preempting_compactions
flag.meaning: Whether a compaction may be preempted in favor of another compaction with higher priority

flag.name: rpc_acceptor_listen_backlog
flag.meaning: Socket backlog parameter used when listening for RPC connections. This defines the maximum length to which the queue of pending TCP connections inbound to the RPC server may grow. If a connection request arrives when the queue is full, the client may receive an error. Higher values may help the server ride over bursts of new inbound connection requests.

flag.name: binary_call_parser_reject_on_mem_tracker_hard_limit
flag.meaning: Whether to reject/ignore calls on hitting mem tracker hard limit.

flag.name: rpc_throttle_threshold_bytes
flag.meaning: Throttle inbound RPC calls larger than specified size on hitting mem tracker soft limit. Throttling is disabled if negative value is specified.

flag.name: rpc_connection_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout for RPC connection operations

flag.name: read_buffer_memory_limit
flag.meaning: Overall limit for read buffers. Positive value - limit in bytes. Negative value - percents of RAM. Zero - unlimited.

flag.name: collect_end_to_end_traces
flag.meaning: If true, collected traces includes information for sub-components potentially running on a different server.

flag.name: print_trace_every
flag.meaning: Controls the rate at which traces are printed. Setting this to 0 disables printing the collected traces.

flag.name: rpc_dump_all_traces
flag.meaning: If true, dump all RPC traces at INFO level

flag.name: rpc_slow_query_threshold_ms
flag.meaning: Traces for calls that take longer than this threshold (in ms) are logged

flag.name: io_thread_pool_size
flag.meaning: Size of allocated IO Thread Pool.

flag.name: outbound_rpc_memory_limit
flag.meaning: Outbound RPC memory limit

flag.name: rpc_default_keepalive_time_ms
flag.meaning: If an RPC connection from a client is idle for this amount of time, the server will disconnect the client. Setting flag to 0 disables this clean up.

flag.name: rpc_queue_limit
flag.meaning: Queue limit for rpc server

flag.name: rpc_workers_limit
flag.meaning: Workers limit for rpc server

flag.name: socket_receive_buffer_size
flag.meaning: Socket receive buffer size, 0 to use default

flag.name: rpc_callback_max_cycles
flag.meaning: The maximum number of cycles for which an RPC callback should be allowed to run without emitting a warning. (Advanced debugging option)

flag.name: num_connections_to_server
flag.meaning: Number of underlying connections to each server

flag.name: proxy_resolve_cache_ms
flag.meaning: Time in milliseconds to cache resolution result in Proxy

flag.name: linear_backoff_ms
flag.meaning: Number of milliseconds added to delay while using linear backoff strategy.

flag.name: max_backoff_ms_exponent
flag.meaning: Max amount of backoff delay if the server responds with TOO BUSY (default: 64 sec). Set this to some duration, past which you are okay having no backoff for a Ddos style build-up, during times when the server is overloaded, and unable to recover.

flag.name: min_backoff_ms_exponent
flag.meaning: Min amount of backoff delay if the server responds with TOO BUSY (default: 128ms). Set this to some amount, during which the server might have recovered.

flag.name: rpcs_shutdown_extra_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Extra allowed time for a single RPC command to complete after its deadline.

flag.name: rpcs_shutdown_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout for a batch of multiple RPCs invoked in parallel to shutdown.

flag.name: allow_insecure_connections
flag.meaning: Whether we should allow insecure connections.

flag.name: cipher_list
flag.meaning: Define the list of available ciphers (TLSv1.2 and below).

flag.name: dump_certificate_entries
flag.meaning: Whether we should dump certificate entries.

flag.name: ssl_protocols
flag.meaning: List of allowed SSL protocols (ssl2, ssl3, tls10, tls11, tls12). Empty to allow TLS only.

flag.name: TEST_enable_backpressure_mode_for_testing
flag.meaning: For testing purposes. Enables the rpc's to be considered timed out in the queue even when we have not had any backpressure in the recent past. (For testing only!)

flag.name: backpressure_recovery_period_ms
flag.meaning: Once we hit a backpressure/service-overflow we will consider dropping stale requests for this duration (in ms)

flag.name: max_time_in_queue_ms
flag.meaning: Fail calls that get stuck in the queue longer than the specified amount of time (in ms)

flag.name: TEST_delay_connect_ms
flag.meaning: Delay connect in tests for specified amount of milliseconds. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_yb_inbound_big_calls_parse_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Test flag for simulating slow parsing of inbound calls larger than rpc_throttle_threshold_bytes (For testing only!)

flag.name: enable_rpc_keepalive
flag.meaning: Whether to enable RPC keepalive mechanism

flag.name: min_sidecar_buffer_size
flag.meaning: Minimal buffer to allocate for sidecar

flag.name: rpc_max_message_size
flag.meaning: The maximum size of a message of any RPC that the server will accept.

flag.name: web_log_bytes
flag.meaning: The maximum number of bytes to display on the debug webserver's log page

flag.name: fail_on_out_of_range_clock_skew
flag.meaning: In case transactional tables are present, crash the process if clock skew greater than the configured maximum.

flag.name: time_source
flag.meaning: The clock source that HybridClock should use (for tests only). Leave empty for WallClock, other values depend on added clock providers and specific for appropriate tests, that adds them.

flag.name: use_hybrid_clock
flag.meaning: Whether HybridClock should be used as the default clock implementation. This should be disabled for testing purposes only.

flag.name: rpc_bind_addresses
flag.meaning: Comma-separated list of addresses to bind to for RPC connections. Currently, ephemeral ports (i.e. port 0) are not allowed.

flag.name: rpc_server_allow_ephemeral_ports
flag.meaning: Allow binding to ephemeral ports. This can cause problems, so currently only allowed in tests.

flag.name: TEST_check_broadcast_address
flag.meaning: Break connectivity in test mini cluster to check broadcast address.

flag.name: TEST_nodes_per_cloud
flag.meaning: Number of nodes per cloud to test private and public addresses. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_public_hostname_suffix
flag.meaning: Suffix for public hostnames. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_simulate_port_conflict_error
flag.meaning: Simulate a port conflict error during initialization. (For testing only!)

flag.name: generic_svc_num_threads
flag.meaning: Number of RPC worker threads to run for the generic service

flag.name: generic_svc_queue_length
flag.meaning: RPC Queue length for the generic service

flag.name: num_reactor_threads
flag.meaning: Number of libev reactor threads to start. If -1, the value is automatically set.

flag.name: yb_test_name
flag.meaning: Specifies test name this daemon is running as part of.

flag.name: master_discovery_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout for masters to discover each other during cluster creation/startup

flag.name: metrics_log_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Interval (in milliseconds) at which the server will dump its metrics to a local log file. The log files are located in the same directory as specified by the -log_dir flag. If this is not a positive value, then metrics logging will be disabled.

flag.name: placement_cloud
flag.meaning: The cloud in which this instance is started.

flag.name: placement_region
flag.meaning: The cloud region in which this instance is started.

flag.name: placement_uuid
flag.meaning: The uuid of the tservers cluster/placement.

flag.name: placement_zone
flag.meaning: The cloud availability zone in which this instance is started.

flag.name: server_broadcast_addresses
flag.meaning: Broadcast addresses for this server.

flag.name: server_dump_info_format
flag.meaning: Format for --server_dump_info_path. This may be either 'pb' or 'json'.

flag.name: server_dump_info_path
flag.meaning: Path into which the server information will be dumped after startup. The dumped data is described by ServerStatusPB in server_base.proto. The dump format is determined by --server_dump_info_format

flag.name: memory_limit_termination_threshold_pct
flag.meaning: If the RSS (resident set size) of the program reaches this percentage of the root memory tracker limit, the program will exit. RSS is measured using operating system means, not the memory allocator. Set to 0 to disable this behavior.

flag.name: total_mem_watcher_interval_millis
flag.meaning: Interval in milliseconds between checking the total memory usage of the current process as seen by the operating system, and deciding whether to terminate in case of excessive memory consumption.

flag.name: webserver_max_post_length_bytes
flag.meaning: The maximum length of a POST request that will be accepted by the embedded web server.

flag.name: webserver_authentication_domain
flag.meaning: Domain used for debug webserver authentication

flag.name: webserver_certificate_file
flag.meaning: The location of the debug webserver's SSL certificate file, in .pem format. If empty, webserver SSL support is not enabled

flag.name: webserver_doc_root
flag.meaning: Files under <webserver_doc_root> are accessible via the debug webserver. Defaults to $YB_HOME/www, or if $YB_HOME is not set, disables the document root

flag.name: webserver_enable_doc_root
flag.meaning: If true, webserver may serve static files from the webserver_doc_root

flag.name: webserver_interface
flag.meaning: Interface to start debug webserver on. If blank, webserver binds to first host IPpresent in the list of comma separated rpc_bind_addresses

flag.name: webserver_num_worker_threads
flag.meaning: Maximum number of threads to start for handling web server requests

flag.name: webserver_password_file
flag.meaning: (Optional) Location of .htpasswd file containing user names and hashed passwords for debug webserver authentication

flag.name: webserver_port
flag.meaning: Port to bind to for the web server

flag.name: apply_intents_task_injected_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Inject such delay before applying intents for large transactions. Could be used to throttle the apply speed.

flag.name: enable_maintenance_manager
flag.meaning: Enable the maintenance manager, runs compaction and tablet cleaning tasks.

flag.name: maintenance_manager_history_size
flag.meaning: Number of completed operations the manager is keeping track of.

flag.name: maintenance_manager_num_threads
flag.meaning: Size of the maintenance manager thread pool. Beyond a value of '1', one thread is reserved for emergency flushes. For spinning disks, the number of threads should not be above the number of devices.

flag.name: maintenance_manager_polling_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Polling interval for the maintenance manager scheduler, in milliseconds.

flag.name: TEST_mvcc_op_trace_num_items
flag.meaning: Number of items to keep in an MvccManager operation trace. Set to 0 to disable MVCC operation tracing. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_delay_execute_async_ms
flag.meaning: Delay execution of ExecuteAsync for specified amount of milliseconds during tests (For testing only!)

flag.name: tablet_operation_memory_limit_mb
flag.meaning: Maximum amount of memory that may be consumed by all in-flight operations belonging to a particular tablet. When this limit is reached, new operations will be rejected and clients will be forced to retry them. If -1, operation memory tracking is disabled.

flag.name: TEST_tablet_inject_latency_on_apply_write_txn_ms
flag.meaning: How much latency to inject when a write operation is applied. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_tablet_pause_apply_write_ops
flag.meaning: Pause applying of write operations. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_preparer_batch_inject_latency_ms
flag.meaning: Inject latency before replicating batch. (For testing only!)

flag.name: max_group_replicate_batch_size
flag.meaning: Maximum number of operations to submit to consensus for replication in a batch.

flag.name: TEST_transaction_delay_status_reply_usec_in_tests
flag.meaning: For tests only. Delay handling status reply by specified amount of usec. (For testing only!)

flag.name: transaction_abort_check_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Interval to check whether running transaction was aborted.

flag.name: transaction_abort_check_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout used when checking for aborted transactions.

flag.name: TEST_backfill_paging_size
flag.meaning: If set > 0, returns early after processing this number of rows. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_disable_adding_user_frontier_to_sst
flag.meaning: Prevents adding the UserFrontier to SST file in order to mimic older files. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_docdb_log_write_batches
flag.meaning: Dump write batches being written to RocksDB (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_export_intentdb_metrics
flag.meaning: Dump intentsdb statistics to prometheus metrics (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_pause_before_post_split_compation
flag.meaning: Pause before triggering post split compaction. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_slowdown_backfill_by_ms
flag.meaning: If set > 0, slows down the backfill process by this amount. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_tablet_verify_flushed_frontier_after_modifying
flag.meaning: After modifying the flushed frontier in RocksDB, verify that the restored value of it is as expected. Used for testing. (For testing only!)

flag.name: backfill_index_rate_rows_per_sec
flag.meaning: Rate of at which the indexed table's entries are populated into the index table during index backfill. This is a per-tablet flag, i.e. a tserver responsible for multiple tablets could be processing more than this.

flag.name: backfill_index_timeout_grace_margin_ms
flag.meaning: The time we give the backfill process to wrap up the current set of writes and return successfully the RPC with the information about how far we have processed the rows.

flag.name: backfill_index_write_batch_size
flag.meaning: The batch size for backfilling the index.

flag.name: cleanup_intents_sst_files
flag.meaning: Cleanup intents files that are no more relevant to any running transaction.

flag.name: delete_intents_sst_files
flag.meaning: Delete whole intents .SST files when possible.

flag.name: disable_alter_vs_write_mutual_exclusion
flag.meaning: A safety switch to disable the changes from D8710 which makes a schema operation take an exclusive lock making all write operations wait for it.

flag.name: intents_flush_max_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Max time to wait for regular db to flush during flush of intents. After this time flush of regular db will be forced.

flag.name: num_raft_ops_to_force_idle_intents_db_to_flush
flag.meaning: When writes to intents RocksDB are stopped and the number of Raft operations after the last write to the intents RocksDB is greater than this value, the intents RocksDB would be requested to flush.

flag.name: tablet_bloom_block_size
flag.meaning: Block size of the bloom filters used for tablet keys.

flag.name: tablet_bloom_target_fp_rate
flag.meaning: Target false-positive rate (between 0 and 1) to size tablet key bloom filters. A lower false positive rate may reduce the number of disk seeks required in heavy insert workloads, at the expense of more space and RAM required for bloom filters.

flag.name: tablet_do_compaction_cleanup_for_intents
flag.meaning: Whether to clean up intents for aborted transactions in compaction.

flag.name: tablet_do_dup_key_checks
flag.meaning: Whether to check primary keys for duplicate on insertion. Use at your own risk!

flag.name: tablet_rocksdb_ops_quiet_down_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Max amount of time we can wait for read/write operations on RocksDB to finish so that we can perform exclusive-ownership operations on RocksDB, such as removing all data in the tablet by replacing the RocksDB instance with an empty one.

flag.name: TEST_fault_crash_during_log_replay
flag.meaning: Fraction of the time when the tablet will crash immediately after processing a log entry during log replay. (For testing only!)

flag.name: force_recover_flushed_frontier
flag.meaning: Could be used to ignore the flushed frontier metadata from RocksDB manifest and recover it from the log instead.

flag.name: skip_flushed_entries
flag.meaning: Only replay WAL entries that are not flushed to RocksDB or within the retryable request timeout.

flag.name: skip_remove_old_recovery_dir
flag.meaning: Skip removing WAL recovery dir after startup. (useful for debugging)

flag.name: skip_wal_rewrite
flag.meaning: Skip rewriting WAL files during bootstrap.

flag.name: transaction_status_tablet_log_segment_size_bytes
flag.meaning: The segment size for transaction status tablet log roll-overs, in bytes.

flag.name: enable_tablet_orphaned_block_deletion
flag.meaning: Whether to enable deletion of orphaned blocks from disk. Note: This is only exposed for debugging purposes!

flag.name: TEST_delay_init_tablet_peer_ms
flag.meaning: Wait before executing init tablet peer for specified amount of milliseconds. (For testing only!)

flag.name: cdc_min_replicated_index_considered_stale_secs
flag.meaning: If cdc_min_replicated_index hasn't been replicated in this amount of time, we reset itsvalue to max int64 to avoid retaining any logs

flag.name: propagate_safe_time
flag.meaning: Propagate safe time to read from leader to followers

flag.name: enable_history_cutoff_propagation
flag.meaning: Should we use history cutoff propagation (true) or calculate it locally (false).

flag.name: history_cutoff_propagation_interval_ms
flag.meaning: History cutoff propagation interval in milliseconds.

flag.name: timestamp_history_retention_interval_sec
flag.meaning: The time interval in seconds to retain DocDB history for. Point-in-time reads at a hybrid time further than this in the past might not be allowed after a compaction. Set this to be higher than the expected maximum duration of any single transaction in your application.

flag.name: TEST_inject_txn_get_status_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Inject specified delay to transaction get status requests. (For testing only!)

flag.name: avoid_abort_after_sealing_ms
flag.meaning: If transaction was only sealed, we will try to abort it not earlier than this period in milliseconds.

flag.name: transaction_check_interval_usec
flag.meaning: Transaction check interval in usec.

flag.name: transaction_max_missed_heartbeat_periods
flag.meaning: Maximum heartbeat periods that a pending transaction can miss before the transaction coordinator expires the transaction. The total expiration time in microseconds is transaction_heartbeat_usec times transaction_max_missed_heartbeat_periods. The value passed to this flag may be fractional.

flag.name: transaction_resend_applying_interval_usec
flag.meaning: Transaction resend applying interval in usec.

flag.name: TEST_inject_load_transaction_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Inject delay before loading each transaction at startup. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_fail_in_apply_if_no_metadata
flag.meaning: Fail when applying intents if metadata is not found. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_transaction_ignore_applying_probability_in_tests
flag.meaning: Probability to ignore APPLYING update in tests. (For testing only!)

flag.name: max_transactions_in_status_request
flag.meaning: Request status for at most specified number of transactions at once. 0 disables load time transaction status resolution.

flag.name: transaction_min_running_check_delay_ms
flag.meaning: When transaction with minimal start hybrid time is updated at transaction participant, we wait at least this number of milliseconds before checking its status at transaction coordinator. Used for the optimization that deletes provisional records RocksDB SSTable files.

flag.name: transaction_min_running_check_interval_ms
flag.meaning: While transaction with minimal start hybrid time remains the same, we will try to check its status at transaction coordinator at regular intervals this long (ms). Used for the optimization that deletes provisional records RocksDB SSTable files.

flag.name: transactions_cleanup_cache_size
flag.meaning: Transactions cleanup cache size.

flag.name: transactions_poll_check_aborted
flag.meaning: Check aborted transactions during poll.

flag.name: transactions_status_poll_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Transactions poll interval.

flag.name: TEST_inject_status_resolver_complete_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Inject delay before counting down latch in transaction status resolver complete. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_inject_status_resolver_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Inject delay before launching transaction status resolver RPC. (For testing only!)

flag.name: heartbeat_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Interval at which the TS heartbeats to the master.

flag.name: heartbeat_max_failures_before_backoff
flag.meaning: Maximum number of consecutive heartbeat failures until the Tablet Server backs off to the normal heartbeat interval, rather than retrying.

flag.name: heartbeat_rpc_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout used for the TS->Master heartbeat RPCs.

flag.name: tserver_disable_heartbeat_test_only
flag.meaning: Should heartbeat be disabled

flag.name: metrics_snapshotter_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Interval at which the metrics are snapshotted.

flag.name: metrics_snapshotter_table_metrics_whitelist
flag.meaning: Table metrics to record in native metrics storage.

flag.name: metrics_snapshotter_tserver_metrics_whitelist
flag.meaning: Tserver metrics to record in native metrics storage.

flag.name: metrics_snapshotter_ttl_ms
flag.meaning: Ttl for snapshotted metrics.

flag.name: tserver_metrics_snapshotter_yb_client_default_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Default timeout for the YBClient embedded into the tablet server that is used by metrics snapshotter.

flag.name: TEST_private_broadcast_address
flag.meaning: Use private address for broadcast address in tests. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_download_partial_wal_segments
flag.meaning: (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_fault_crash_bootstrap_client_before_changing_role
flag.meaning: The remote bootstrap client will crash before closing the session with the leader. Because the session won't be closed successfully, the leader won't issue a ChangeConfig request to change this tserver role *(from PRE_VOTER or PRE_OBSERVER to VOTER or OBSERVER respectively). (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_simulate_long_remote_bootstrap_sec
flag.meaning: The remote bootstrap client will take at least this number of seconds to finish. We use this for testing a scenario where a remote bootstrap takes longer than follower_unavailable_considered_failed_sec seconds. (For testing only!)

flag.name: committed_config_change_role_timeout_sec
flag.meaning: Number of seconds to wait for the CHANGE_ROLE to be in the committed config before timing out.

flag.name: remote_bootstrap_begin_session_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Tablet server RPC client timeout for BeginRemoteBootstrapSession calls.

flag.name: remote_bootstrap_end_session_timeout_sec
flag.meaning: Tablet server RPC client timeout for EndRemoteBootstrapSession calls. The timeout is usually a large value because we have to wait for the remote server to get a CHANGE_ROLE config change accepted.

flag.name: remote_bootstrap_save_downloaded_metadata
flag.meaning: Save copies of the downloaded remote bootstrap files for debugging purposes. Note: This is only intended for debugging and should not be normally used!

flag.name: bytes_remote_bootstrap_durable_write_mb
flag.meaning: Explicitly call fsync after downloading the specified amount of data in MB during a remote bootstrap session. If 0 fsync() is not called.

flag.name: remote_boostrap_rate_limit_bytes_per_sec
flag.meaning: DEPRECATED. Replaced by flag remote_bootstrap_rate_limit_bytes_per_sec.

flag.name: remote_bootstrap_max_chunk_size
flag.meaning: Maximum chunk size to be transferred at a time during remote bootstrap.

flag.name: remote_bootstrap_rate_limit_bytes_per_sec
flag.meaning: Maximum transmission rate during a remote bootstrap. This is across all the remote bootstrap sessions for which this process is acting as a sender or receiver. So the total limit will be 2 * remote_bootstrap_rate_limit_bytes_per_sec because a tserver or master can act both as a sender and receiver at the same time.

flag.name: TEST_fault_crash_leader_after_changing_role
