flag.meaning: The leader will crash after successfully sending a ChangeConfig (CHANGE_ROLE from PRE_VOTER or PRE_OBSERVER to VOTER or OBSERVER respectively) for the tablet server it is remote bootstrapping, but before it sends a success response. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_fault_crash_leader_before_changing_role
flag.meaning: The leader will crash before changing the role (from PRE_VOTER or PRE_OBSERVER to VOTER or OBSERVER respectively) of the tablet server it is remote bootstrapping. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_fault_crash_on_handle_rb_fetch_data
flag.meaning: Fraction of the time when the tablet will crash while servicing a RemoteBootstrapService FetchData() RPC call. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_inject_latency_before_change_role_secs
flag.meaning: Number of seconds to sleep before we call ChangeRole. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_skip_change_role
flag.meaning: When set, we don't call ChangeRole after successfully finishing a remote bootstrap. (For testing only!)

flag.name: remote_bootstrap_change_role_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout for change role operation during remote bootstrap.

flag.name: remote_bootstrap_idle_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Amount of time without activity before a remote bootstrap session will expire, in millis

flag.name: remote_bootstrap_timeout_poll_period_ms
flag.meaning: How often the remote_bootstrap service polls for expired remote bootstrap sessions, in millis

flag.name: TEST_pretend_memory_exceeded_enforce_flush
flag.meaning: Always pretend memory has been exceeded to enforce background flush. (For testing only!)

flag.name: db_block_cache_num_shard_bits
flag.meaning: Number of bits to use for sharding the block cache (defaults to 4 bits)

flag.name: db_block_cache_size_bytes
flag.meaning: Size of RocksDB block cache (in bytes). This defaults to -1 for system auto-generated default, which would use FLAGS_db_block_cache_size_percentage to select a percentage of the total memory as the default size for the shared block cache. Value of -2 disables block cache.

flag.name: db_block_cache_size_percentage
flag.meaning: Default percentage of total available memory to use as block cache size, if not asking for a raw number, through FLAGS_db_block_cache_size_bytes. Defaults to -3 (use default percentage as defined by master or tserver).

flag.name: enable_block_based_table_cache_gc
flag.meaning: Set to true to enable block based table garbage collector.

flag.name: enable_log_cache_gc
flag.meaning: Set to true to enable log cache garbage collector.

flag.name: flush_background_task_interval_msec
flag.meaning: The tick interval time for the flush background task. This defaults to 0, which means disable the background task And only use callbacks on memstore allocations.

flag.name: global_memstore_size_mb_max
flag.meaning: Global memstore size is determined as a percentage of the available memory. However, this flag limits it in absolute size. Value of 0 means no limit on the value obtained by the percentage. Default is 2048.

flag.name: global_memstore_size_percentage
flag.meaning: Percentage of total available memory to use for the global memstore. Default is 10. See also memstore_size_mb and global_memstore_size_mb_max.

flag.name: log_cache_gc_evict_only_over_allocated
flag.meaning: If set to true, log cache garbage collection would evict only memory that was allocated over limit for log cache. Otherwise it will try to evict requested number of bytes.

flag.name: cql_proxy_bind_address
flag.meaning: Address to bind the CQL proxy to

flag.name: cql_proxy_webserver_port
flag.meaning: Webserver port for CQL proxy

flag.name: enable_direct_local_tablet_server_call
flag.meaning: Enable direct call to local tablet server

flag.name: inbound_rpc_memory_limit
flag.meaning: Inbound RPC memory limit

flag.name: pgsql_proxy_bind_address
flag.meaning: Address to bind the PostgreSQL proxy to

flag.name: redis_proxy_bind_address
flag.meaning: Address to bind the redis proxy to

flag.name: redis_proxy_webserver_port
flag.meaning: Webserver port for redis proxy

flag.name: start_pgsql_proxy
flag.meaning: Whether to run a PostgreSQL server as a child process of the tablet server

flag.name: tablet_server_svc_num_threads
flag.meaning: Number of RPC worker threads for the TS service. If -1, it is auto configured.

flag.name: tablet_server_svc_queue_length
flag.meaning: RPC queue length for the TS service.

flag.name: ts_admin_svc_num_threads
flag.meaning: Number of RPC worker threads for the TS admin service

flag.name: ts_admin_svc_queue_length
flag.meaning: RPC queue length for the TS admin service

flag.name: ts_consensus_svc_num_threads
flag.meaning: Number of RPC worker threads for the TS consensus service. If -1, it is auto configured.

flag.name: ts_consensus_svc_queue_length
flag.meaning: RPC queue length for the TS consensus service.

flag.name: ts_remote_bootstrap_svc_num_threads
flag.meaning: Number of RPC worker threads for the TS remote bootstrap service

flag.name: ts_remote_bootstrap_svc_queue_length
flag.meaning: RPC queue length for the TS remote bootstrap service

flag.name: tserver_enable_metrics_snapshotter
flag.meaning: Should metrics snapshotter be enabled

flag.name: cql_proxy_broadcast_rpc_address
flag.meaning: RPC address to broadcast to other nodes. This is the broadcast_address used in the system.local table

flag.name: start_cql_proxy
flag.meaning: Starts a CQL proxy along with the tablet server

flag.name: start_redis_proxy
flag.meaning: Starts a redis proxy along with the tablet server

flag.name: tserver_tcmalloc_max_total_thread_cache_bytes
flag.meaning: Total number of bytes to use for the thread cache for tcmalloc across all threads in the tserver.

flag.name: TEST_alter_schema_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Delay before processing AlterSchema. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_assert_reads_from_follower_rejected_because_of_staleness
flag.meaning: If set, we verify that the consistency level is CONSISTENT_PREFIX, and that a follower receives the request, but that it gets rejected because it's a stale follower (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_assert_reads_served_by_follower
flag.meaning: If set, we verify that the consistency level is CONSISTENT_PREFIX, and that this server is not the leader for the tablet (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_leader_stepdown_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Amount of time to delay before starting a leader stepdown change. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_respond_write_failed_probability
flag.meaning: Probability to respond that write request is failed (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_rpc_delete_tablet_fail
flag.meaning: Should delete tablet RPC fail. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_scanner_inject_latency_on_each_batch_ms
flag.meaning: If set, the scanner will pause the specified number of milliesconds before reading each batch of data on the tablet server. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_simulate_time_out_failures_msecs
flag.meaning: If greater than 0, we will randomly mark read requests as timed out and sleep for the specificed amount of time by this flag to simulate time out failures. The requester will mark the timed out replica as failed, and its periodic refresh mechanism for the lookup cache will mark them as available. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_transactional_read_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Amount of time to delay between transaction status check and reading start. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_tserver_noop_read_write
flag.meaning: Respond NOOP to read/write. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_txn_status_table_tablet_creation_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Extra delay to slowdown creation of transaction status table tablet. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_write_rejection_percentage
flag.meaning: Reject specified percentage of writes. (For testing only!)

flag.name: index_backfill_additional_delay_before_backfilling_ms
flag.meaning: Operations that are received by the tserver, and have decided how the indexes need to be updated (based on the IndexPermission), will not be added to the list of current transactions until they are replicated/applied. This delay allows for the GetSafeTime method to wait for such operations to be replicated/applied. Ideally, this value should be set to be something larger than the raft-heartbeat-interval but can be as high as the client_rpc_timeout if we want to be more conservative.

flag.name: index_backfill_upperbound_for_user_enforced_txn_duration_ms
flag.meaning: For Non-Txn tables, it is impossible to know at the tservers weather or not an 'old transaction' is still active. To avoid having such old transactions, we assume a bound on the duration of such transactions (during the backfill process) and wait it out. This flag denotes a conservative upper bound on the duration of such user enforced transactions.

flag.name: index_backfill_wait_for_old_txns_ms
flag.meaning: Index backfill needs to wait for transactions that started before the WRITE_AND_DELETE phase to commit or abort before choosing a time for backfilling the index. This is the max time that the GetSafeTime call will wait for, before it resorts to attempt aborting old transactions. This is necessary to guard against the pathological active transaction that never commits, from blocking the index backfill forever.

flag.name: max_stale_read_bound_time_ms
flag.meaning: If we are allowed to read from followers, specify the maximum time a follower can be behind by using the last message received from the leader. If set to zero, a read can be served by a follower regardless of when was the last time it received a message from the leader or how far behind thisfollower is.

flag.name: max_wait_for_safe_time_ms
flag.meaning: Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for the safe time to advance when trying to scan at the given hybrid_time.

flag.name: num_concurrent_backfills_allowed
flag.meaning: Maximum number of concurrent backfill jobs that is allowed to run.

flag.name: parallelize_read_ops
flag.meaning: Controls weather multiple (Redis) read ops that are present in a operation should be executed in parallel.

flag.name: scanner_batch_size_rows
flag.meaning: The number of rows to batch for servicing scan requests.

flag.name: scanner_default_batch_size_bytes
flag.meaning: The default size for batches of scan results

flag.name: scanner_max_batch_size_bytes
flag.meaning: The maximum batch size that a client may request for scan results.

flag.name: sst_files_hard_limit
flag.meaning: When majority SST files number is greater that this limit, we will reject all write requests.

flag.name: sst_files_soft_limit
flag.meaning: When majority SST files number is greater that this limit, we will start rejecting part of write requests. The higher the number of SST files, the higher probability of rejection.

flag.name: tablet_split_monitor_heartbeat_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Interval (in milliseconds) at which tserver check tablets and sends a list of tablets to split in a heartbeat to master.

flag.name: TEST_apply_tablet_split_inject_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Inject delay into TSTabletManager::ApplyTabletSplit. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_crash_before_apply_tablet_split_op
flag.meaning: Crash inside TSTabletManager::ApplyTabletSplit before doing anything (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_crash_if_remote_bootstrap_sessions_greater_than
flag.meaning: If greater than zero, this process will crash if we detect more than the specified number of remote bootstrap sessions. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_crash_if_remote_bootstrap_sessions_per_table_greater_than
flag.meaning: If greater than zero, this process will crash if for any table we exceed the specified number of remote bootstrap sessions (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_fault_crash_after_blocks_deleted
flag.meaning: Fraction of the time when the tablet will crash immediately after deleting the data blocks during tablet deletion. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_fault_crash_after_cmeta_deleted
flag.meaning: Fraction of the time when the tablet will crash immediately after deleting the consensus metadata during tablet deletion. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_fault_crash_after_rb_files_fetched
flag.meaning: Fraction of the time when the tablet will crash immediately after fetching the files during a remote bootstrap but before marking the superblock as TABLET_DATA_READY. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_fault_crash_after_wal_deleted
flag.meaning: Fraction of the time when the tablet will crash immediately after deleting the WAL segments during tablet deletion. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_force_single_tablet_failure
flag.meaning: Force exactly one tablet to a failed state. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_skip_deleting_split_tablets
flag.meaning: Skip deleting tablets which have been split. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_sleep_after_tombstoning_tablet_secs
flag.meaning: Whether we sleep in LogAndTombstone after calling DeleteTabletData. (For testing only!)

flag.name: cleanup_split_tablets_interval_sec
flag.meaning: Interval at which tablet manager tries to cleanup split tablets which are no longer needed. Setting this to 0 disables cleanup of split tablets.

flag.name: enable_restart_transaction_status_tablets_first
flag.meaning: Set to true to prioritize bootstrapping transaction status tablets first.

flag.name: num_tablets_to_open_simultaneously
flag.meaning: Number of threads available to open tablets during startup. If this is set to 0 (the default), then the number of bootstrap threads will be set based on the number of data directories. If the data directories are on some very fast storage device such as SSD or a RAID array, it may make sense to manually tune this.

flag.name: post_split_trigger_compaction_pool_max_queue_size
flag.meaning: The maximum number of tasks that can be held in the pool for post_split_trigger_compaction_pool_. This pool is used to run compactions on tablets after they have been split and still contain irrelevant data from the tablet they were sourced from.

flag.name: post_split_trigger_compaction_pool_max_threads
flag.meaning: The maximum number of threads allowed for post_split_trigger_compaction_pool_. This pool is used to run compactions on tablets after they have been split and still contain irrelevant data from the tablet they were sourced from.

flag.name: read_pool_max_queue_size
flag.meaning: The maximum number of tasks that can be held in the queue for read_pool_. This pool is used to run multiple read operations, that are part of the same tablet rpc, in parallel.

flag.name: read_pool_max_threads
flag.meaning: The maximum number of threads allowed for read_pool_. This pool is used to run multiple read operations, that are part of the same tablet rpc, in parallel.

flag.name: tablet_start_warn_threshold_ms
flag.meaning: If a tablet takes more than this number of millis to start, issue a warning with a trace.

flag.name: tserver_yb_client_default_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Default timeout for the YBClient embedded into the tablet server that is used for distributed transactions.

flag.name: tserver_master_addrs
flag.meaning: Comma separated addresses of the masters which the tablet server should connect to. The CQL proxy reads this flag as well to determine the new set of masters

flag.name: tserver_master_replication_factor
flag.meaning: Number of master replicas. By default it is detected based on tserver_master_addrs option, but could be specified explicitly together with passing one or more master service domain name and port through tserver_master_addrs for masters auto-discovery when running on Kubernetes.

flag.name: tserver_heartbeat_metrics_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Interval (in milliseconds) at which tserver sends its metrics in a heartbeat to master.

flag.name: use_icu_timezones
flag.meaning: Use the new ICU library for timezones instead of boost

flag.name: use_libbacktrace
flag.meaning: Whether to use the libbacktrace library for symbolizing stack traces

flag.name: trace_to_console
flag.meaning: Trace pattern specifying which trace events should be dumped directly to the console

flag.name: encryption_counter_overflow_read_path_workaround
flag.meaning: Enable a read-path workaround for the encryption counter overflow bug #3707. This is enabled by default and could be disabled to reproduce the bug in testing.

flag.name: TEST_encryption_use_openssl_compatible_counter_overflow
flag.meaning: Overflow into the rest of the initialization vector when computing counterincrement for newly created keys. (For testing only!)

flag.name: encryption_counter_max
flag.meaning: Maximum value (inclusive) for the randomly generated 32-bit encryption counter at the beginning of a file. Setting to 2147483647 by default to reduce the probability of #3707 until it is fixed. This only reduces the key size by 1 bit but eliminates the encryption overflow issue for files up to 32 GiB in size.

flag.name: encryption_counter_min
flag.meaning: Minimum value (inclusive) for the randomly generated 32-bit encryption counter at the beginning of a file

flag.name: TEST_simulate_free_space_bytes
flag.meaning: If a non-negative value, GetFreeSpaceBytes will return the specified value. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_simulate_fs_without_fallocate
flag.meaning: If true, the system simulates a file system that doesn't support fallocate. (For testing only!)

flag.name: never_fsync
flag.meaning: Never fsync() anything to disk. This is used by certain test cases to speed up runtime. This is very unsafe to use in production.

flag.name: o_direct_block_alignment_bytes
flag.meaning: Alignment (in bytes) for blocks used for O_DIRECT operations.

flag.name: o_direct_block_size_bytes
flag.meaning: Size of the block to use when flag durable_wal_write is set.

flag.name: suicide_on_eio
flag.meaning: Kill the process if an I/O operation results in EIO

flag.name: writable_file_use_fsync
flag.meaning: Use fsync(2) instead of fdatasync(2) for synchronizing dirty data to disk.

flag.name: TEST_running_test
flag.meaning: Flag that is set to true when we running a test (For testing only!)

flag.name: dump_metrics_json
flag.meaning: Dump a JSON document describing all of the metrics which may be emitted by this binary.

flag.name: enable_process_lifetime_heap_profiling
flag.meaning: Enables heap profiling for the lifetime of the process. Profile output will be stored in the directory specified by -heap_profile_path. Enabling this option will disable the on-demand/remote server profile handlers.

flag.name: heap_profile_path
flag.meaning: Output path to store heap profiles. If not set profiles are stored in /tmp/<process-name>.<pid>.<n>.heap.

flag.name: svc_queue_length_default
flag.meaning: Default RPC queue length for a service

flag.name: fs_data_dirs
flag.meaning: Comma-separated list of data directories. This argument must be specified.

flag.name: stop_on_parent_termination
flag.meaning: When specified, this process will terminate when parent process terminates.Linux-only.

flag.name: fatal_details_path_prefix
flag.meaning: A prefix to use for the path of a file to save fatal failure stack trace and other details to.

flag.name: log_filename
flag.meaning: Prefix of log filename - full path is <log_dir>/<log_filename>.[INFO|WARN|ERROR|FATAL]

flag.name: minicluster_daemon_id
flag.meaning: A human-readable 'daemon id', e.g. 'm-1' or 'ts-2', used in tests.

flag.name: ref_counted_debug_type_name_regex
flag.meaning: Regex for type names for debugging RefCounted / scoped_refptr based classes. An empty string disables RefCounted debug logging.

flag.name: default_memory_limit_to_ram_ratio
flag.meaning: If memory_limit_hard_bytes is left unspecified, then it is set to default_memory_limit_to_ram_ratio * Available RAM.

flag.name: mem_tracker_log_stack_trace
flag.meaning: Enable logging of stack traces on memory tracker consume/release operations. Only takes effect if mem_tracker_logging is also enabled.

flag.name: mem_tracker_logging
flag.meaning: Enable logging of memory tracker consume/release operations

flag.name: mem_tracker_update_consumption_interval_us
flag.meaning: Interval that is used to update memory consumption from external source. For instance from tcmalloc statistics.

flag.name: memory_limit_hard_bytes
flag.meaning: Maximum amount of memory this daemon should use, in bytes. A value of 0 autosizes based on the total system memory. A value of -1 disables all memory limiting.

flag.name: memory_limit_soft_percentage
flag.meaning: Percentage of the hard memory limit that this daemon may consume before memory throttling of writes begins. The greater the excess, the higher the chance of throttling. In general, a lower soft limit leads to smoother write latencies but decreased throughput, and vice versa for a higher soft limit.

flag.name: memory_limit_warn_threshold_percentage
flag.meaning: Percentage of the hard memory limit that this daemon may consume before WARNING level messages are periodically logged.

flag.name: tcmalloc_max_free_bytes_percentage
flag.meaning: Maximum percentage of the RSS that tcmalloc is allowed to use for reserved but unallocated memory.

flag.name: arena_warn_threshold_bytes
flag.meaning: Number of bytes beyond which to emit a warning for a large arena

flag.name: allocator_aligned_mode
flag.meaning: Use 16-byte alignment instead of 8-byte, unless explicitly specified otherwise - to boost SIMD

flag.name: expose_metric_histogram_percentiles
flag.meaning: Should we expose the percentiles information for metrics histograms.

flag.name: metric_node_name
flag.meaning: Value to use as node name for metrics reporting

flag.name: metrics_retirement_age_ms
flag.meaning: The minimum number of milliseconds a metric will be kept for after it is no longer active. (Advanced option)

flag.name: dns_cache_expiration_ms
flag.meaning: Time to store DNS resolution results in cache.

flag.name: net_address_filter
flag.meaning: Order in which to select ip addresses returned by the resolverCan be set to something like "ipv4_all,ipv6_all" to prefer IPv4 over IPv6 addresses.Can be set to something like "ipv4_external,ipv4_all,ipv6_all" to prefer external IPv4 addresses first. Other options include ipv6_external,ipv6_non_link_local

flag.name: rate_limiter_min_rate
flag.meaning: Minimum transmission rate in bytes/sec

flag.name: rate_limiter_min_size
flag.meaning: Minimum size for each transmission request

flag.name: local_ip_for_outbound_sockets
flag.meaning: IP to bind to when making outgoing socket connections. This must be an IP address of the form A.B.C.D, not a hostname. Advanced parameter, subject to change.

flag.name: socket_inject_short_recvs
flag.meaning: Inject short recv() responses which return less data than requested

flag.name: disable_clock_sync_error
flag.meaning: Whether or not we should keep running if we detect a clock synchronization issue.

flag.name: max_clock_skew_usec
flag.meaning: Transaction read clock skew in usec. This is the maximum allowed time delta between servers of a single cluster.

flag.name: max_clock_sync_error_usec
flag.meaning: Maximum allowed clock synchronization error as reported by NTP before the server will abort.

flag.name: non_graph_characters_percentage_to_use_hexadecimal_rendering
flag.meaning: Non graph charaters percentage to use hexadecimal rendering

flag.name: lock_contention_trace_threshold_cycles
flag.meaning: If acquiring a spinlock takes more than this number of cycles, and a Trace is currently active, then the current stack trace is logged to the trace buffer.

flag.name: enable_tracing
flag.meaning: Flag to enable/disable tracing across the code.

flag.name: rlimit_as
flag.meaning: Memory size limit: bytes.

flag.name: rlimit_cpu
flag.meaning: CPU time limit: seconds.

flag.name: rlimit_data
flag.meaning: Data file size limit: bytes.

flag.name: rlimit_fsize
flag.meaning: File size limit: blocks.

flag.name: rlimit_memlock
flag.meaning: Locked memory limit: bytes.

flag.name: rlimit_nofile
flag.meaning: Open files limit.

flag.name: rlimit_nproc
flag.meaning: User process limit.

flag.name: rlimit_stack
flag.meaning: Stack size limit: bytes.

flag.name: version_file_json_path
flag.meaning: Path to directory containing JSON file with version info.

flag.name: cql_server_always_send_events
flag.meaning: All CQL connections automatically subscribed for all CQL events.

flag.name: max_message_length
flag.meaning: The maximum message length of the cql message.

flag.name: rpcz_max_cql_batch_dump_count
flag.meaning: The maximum number of CQL batch elements in the RPCZ dump.

flag.name: rpcz_max_cql_query_dump_size
flag.meaning: The maximum size of the CQL query string in the RPCZ dump.

flag.name: throttle_cql_calls_on_soft_memory_limit
flag.meaning: Whether to reject CQL calls when soft memory limit is reached.

flag.name: throttle_cql_calls_policy
flag.meaning: Policy for throttling CQL calls. 1 - drop throttled calls. 0 - respond with OVERLOADED error.

flag.name: cql_nodelist_refresh_interval_secs
flag.meaning: Interval after which a node list refresh event should be sent to all CQL clients.

flag.name: cql_rpc_memory_limit
flag.meaning: CQL RPC memory limit

flag.name: cql_service_queue_length
flag.meaning: RPC queue length for CQL service

flag.name: cql_rpc_keepalive_time_ms
flag.meaning: If an RPC connection from a client is idle for this amount of time, the server will disconnect the client. Setting flag to 0 disables this clean up.

flag.name: cql_processors_limit
flag.meaning: Limit number of CQL processors. Positive means absolute limit. Negative means number of processors per 1GB of root mem tracker memory limit. 0 - unlimited.

flag.name: cql_service_max_prepared_statement_size_bytes
flag.meaning: The maximum amount of memory the CQL proxy should use to maintain prepared statements. 0 or negative means unlimited.

flag.name: cql_ybclient_reactor_threads
flag.meaning: The number of reactor threads to be used for processing ybclient requests originating in the cql layer

flag.name: password_hash_cache_size
flag.meaning: Number of password hashes to cache. 0 or negative disables caching.

flag.name: cql_system_query_cache_empty_responses
flag.meaning: Whether to cache empty responses from the master.

flag.name: cql_system_query_cache_stale_msecs
flag.meaning: Maximum permitted staleness for the system query cache. <= 0 permits infinite staleness.

flag.name: cql_system_query_cache_tables
flag.meaning: Tables to cache connection data for. Entries are semicolon-delimited, in the format <keyspace>.<table>.

flag.name: cql_update_system_query_cache_msecs
flag.meaning: How often the system query cache should be updated. <= 0 disables caching.

flag.name: ycql_audit_excluded_categories
flag.meaning: Comma separated list of categories to be excluded from the audit log

flag.name: ycql_audit_excluded_keyspaces
flag.meaning: Comma separated list of keyspaces to be excluded from the audit log

flag.name: ycql_audit_excluded_users
flag.meaning: Comma separated list of users to be excluded from the audit log

flag.name: ycql_audit_included_categories
flag.meaning: Comma separated list of categories to be included in the audit log, if none - includes all categories

flag.name: ycql_audit_included_keyspaces
flag.meaning: Comma separated list of keyspaces to be included in the audit log, if none - includes all keyspaces

flag.name: ycql_audit_included_users
flag.meaning: Comma separated list of users to be included in the audit log

flag.name: ycql_audit_log_level
flag.meaning: Severity level at which an audit will be logged. Could be INFO, WARNING, or ERROR

flag.name: ycql_enable_audit_log
flag.meaning: Enable YCQL audit. Use ycql_audit_* flags for fine-grained configuration

flag.name: ycql_serial_operation_in_transaction_block
flag.meaning: If true, operations within a transaction block must be executed in order, at least semantically speaking.

flag.name: cql_raise_index_where_clause_error
flag.meaning: Raise unsupported error if where clause is specified for create index

flag.name: cql_table_is_transactional_by_default
flag.meaning: When the 'transactions' property is not specified at CREATE TABLE time for a YCQL table, this flag determines the default setting for whether the table is transactional or not.

flag.name: enable_uncovered_index_select
flag.meaning: Enable executing select statements using uncovered index

flag.name: allow_index_table_read_write
flag.meaning: Allow direct read and write of index tables

flag.name: use_cassandra_authentication
flag.meaning: If to require authentication on startup.

flag.name: ycql_cache_login_info
flag.meaning: Use authentication information cached locally.

flag.name: ycql_require_drop_privs_for_truncate
flag.meaning: Require DROP TABLE permission in order to truncate table

flag.name: TEST_user_ddl_operation_timeout_sec
flag.meaning: Adjusts the timeout for a DDL operation from the YBClient default, if non-zero. (For testing only!)

flag.name: pg_yb_session_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout for operations between PostgreSQL server and YugaByte DocDB services

flag.name: ysql_log_failed_docdb_requests
flag.meaning: Log failed docdb requests.

flag.name: ysql_wait_until_index_permissions_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Timeout for WaitUntilIndexPermissionsAtLeast RPCs from client to master initiated from YSQL layer.

flag.name: TEST_pggate_ignore_tserver_shm
flag.meaning: Ignore the shared memory of the local tablet server. (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_ysql_disable_transparent_cache_refresh_retry
flag.meaning: Never transparently retry commands that fail with cache version mismatch error (For testing only!)

flag.name: TEST_ysql_index_state_flags_update_delay_ms
flag.meaning: Time to delay after changing the pg_index state flags. Currently default 1s because pg_index commits need time to propagate to all tservers (For testing only!)

flag.name: pggate_master_addresses
flag.meaning: Addresses of the master servers to which the PostgreSQL proxy server connects.

flag.name: pggate_proxy_bind_address
flag.meaning: Address to which the PostgreSQL proxy server is bound.

flag.name: pggate_rpc_timeout_secs
flag.meaning: Timeout for RPCs from pggate to YB cluster

flag.name: pggate_tserver_shm_fd
flag.meaning: File descriptor of the local tablet server's shared memory.

flag.name: pggate_ybclient_reactor_threads
flag.meaning: The number of reactor threads to be used for processing ybclient requests originating in the PostgreSQL proxy server

flag.name: pgsql_rpc_keepalive_time_ms
flag.meaning: If an RPC connection from a client is idle for this amount of time, the server will disconnect the client. Setting flag to 0 disables this clean up.

flag.name: ysql_backward_prefetch_scale_factor
flag.meaning: Scale factor to reduce ysql_prefetch_limit for backward scan

flag.name: ysql_beta_feature_extension
flag.meaning: Whether to enable the 'extension' ysql beta feature

flag.name: ysql_beta_feature_tablegroup
flag.meaning: Whether to enable the incomplete 'tablegroup' ysql beta feature

flag.name: ysql_beta_features
flag.meaning: Whether to enable all ysql beta features

flag.name: ysql_enable_manual_sys_table_txn_ctl
flag.meaning: Enable manual transaction control for YSQL system tables. Mostly needed for testing. This flag should go away once full transactional DDL is implemented.

flag.name: ysql_enable_update_batching
flag.meaning: Whether to enable batching of updates where possible. Currently update batching is only supported for PGSQL procedures.

flag.name: ysql_max_read_restart_attempts
flag.meaning: How many read restarts can we try transparently before giving up

flag.name: ysql_max_write_restart_attempts
flag.meaning: Max number of restart attempts made for writes on transaction conflicts.

flag.name: ysql_non_txn_copy
flag.meaning: Execute COPY inserts non-transactionally.

flag.name: ysql_output_buffer_size
flag.meaning: Size of postgres-level output buffer, in bytes. While fetched data resides within this buffer and hasn't been flushed to client yet, we're free to transparently restart operation in case of restart read error.

flag.name: ysql_prefetch_limit
flag.meaning: Maximum number of rows to prefetch

flag.name: ysql_request_limit
flag.meaning: Maximum number of requests to be sent at once

flag.name: ysql_select_parallelism
flag.meaning: Number of read requests to issue in parallel to tablets of a table for SELECT.

flag.name: ysql_sequence_cache_minval
flag.meaning: Set how many sequence numbers to be preallocated in cache.

flag.name: ysql_serializable_isolation_for_ddl_txn
flag.meaning: Whether to use serializable isolation for separate DDL-only transactions. By default, repeatable read isolation is used. This flag should go away once full transactional DDL is implemented.

flag.name: ysql_session_max_batch_size
flag.meaning: Maximum batch size for buffered writes between PostgreSQL server and YugaByte DocDB services

flag.name: ysql_sleep_before_retry_on_txn_conflict
flag.meaning: Whether to sleep before retrying the write on transaction conflicts.

flag.name: ysql_suppress_unsupported_error
flag.meaning: Suppress ERROR on use of unsupported SQL statement and use WARNING instead

flag.name: pggate_num_connections_to_server
flag.meaning: Number of underlying connections to each server from a PostgreSQL backend process. This overrides the value of --num_connections_to_server.

flag.name: pg_proxy_bind_address
flag.meaning: Address for the PostgreSQL proxy to bind to

flag.name: pg_stat_statements_enabled
flag.meaning: True to enable statement stats in PostgreSQL server

flag.name: pg_transactions_enabled
flag.meaning: True to enable transactions in YugaByte PostgreSQL API. This should eventually be set to true by default.

flag.name: pg_verbose_error_log
flag.meaning: True to enable verbose logging of errors in PostgreSQL server

flag.name: pgsql_proxy_webserver_port
flag.meaning: Webserver port for PGSQL

flag.name: ysql_datestyle
flag.meaning: Overrides the default ysql display format for date and time values

flag.name: ysql_default_transaction_isolation
flag.meaning: Overrides the default ysql transaction isolation level

flag.name: ysql_enable_auth
flag.meaning: True to enforce password authentication for all connections

flag.name: ysql_hba_conf
flag.meaning: Deprecated, use `ysql_hba_conf_csv` flag instead. Comma separated list of postgres hba rules (in order)

flag.name: ysql_hba_conf_csv
flag.meaning: CSV formatted line represented list of postgres hba rules (in order)

flag.name: ysql_log_min_duration_statement
flag.meaning: Sets the duration of each completed ysql statement to be logged if the statement ran for at least the specified number of milliseconds.

flag.name: ysql_log_min_messages
flag.meaning: Sets the lowest ysql message level to log

flag.name: ysql_log_statement
flag.meaning: Sets which types of ysql statements should be logged

flag.name: ysql_max_connections
flag.meaning: Overrides the maximum number of concurrent ysql connections

flag.name: ysql_pg_conf
flag.meaning: Deprecated, use the `ysql_pg_conf_csv` flag instead. Comma separated list of postgres setting assignments

flag.name: ysql_pg_conf_csv
flag.meaning: CSV formatted line represented list of postgres setting assignments

flag.name: ysql_timezone
flag.meaning: Overrides the default ysql timezone for displaying and interpreting timestamps

flag.name: redis_keys_threshold
flag.meaning: Maximum number of keys allowed to be in the db before the KEYS operation errors out

flag.name: redis_passwords_separator
flag.meaning: The character used to separate multiple passwords.

flag.name: use_hashed_redis_password
flag.meaning: Store the hash of the redis passwords instead.

flag.name: yedis_enable_flush
flag.meaning: Enables FLUSHDB and FLUSHALL commands in yedis.

flag.name: redis_connection_soft_limit_grace_period_sec
flag.meaning: The duration for which the outbound data needs to exceeed the softlimit before the connection gets closed down.

flag.name: redis_max_batch
flag.meaning: Max number of redis commands that forms batch

flag.name: redis_max_concurrent_commands
flag.meaning: Max number of redis commands received from single connection, that could be processed concurrently

flag.name: redis_max_queued_bytes
flag.meaning: Max number of bytes in queued redis commands.

flag.name: redis_max_read_buffer_size
flag.meaning: Max read buffer size for Redis connections.

flag.name: rpcz_max_redis_query_dump_size
flag.meaning: The maximum size of the Redis query string in the RPCZ dump.

flag.name: redis_rpc_block_size
flag.meaning: Redis RPC block size

flag.name: redis_rpc_memory_limit
flag.meaning: Redis RPC memory limit

flag.name: redis_svc_queue_length
flag.meaning: RPC queue length for redis service

flag.name: redis_rpc_keepalive_time_ms
flag.meaning: If an RPC connection from a client is idle for this amount of time, the server will disconnect the client. Setting flag to 0 disables this clean up.

flag.name: enable_redis_auth
flag.meaning: Enable AUTH for the Redis service

flag.name: redis_callbacks_threadpool_size
flag.meaning: The maximum size for the threadpool which handles callbacks from the ybclient layer

flag.name: redis_max_command_size
flag.meaning: Maximum size of the command in redis

flag.name: redis_max_value_size
flag.meaning: Maximum size of the value in redis

flag.name: redis_password_caching_duration_ms
flag.meaning: The duration for which we will cache the redis passwords. 0 to disable.

flag.name: redis_safe_batch
flag.meaning: Use safe batching with Redis service

flag.name: redis_service_yb_client_timeout_millis
flag.meaning: Timeout in milliseconds for RPC calls from Redis service to master/tserver

flag.name: flagfile
flag.meaning: load flags from file

flag.name: fromenv
flag.meaning: set flags from the environment [use 'export FLAGS_flag1=value']

flag.name: tryfromenv
flag.meaning: set flags from the environment if present

flag.name: undefok
flag.meaning: comma-separated list of flag names that it is okay to specify on the command line even if the program does not define a flag with that name. IMPORTANT: flags in this list that have arguments MUST use the flag=value format

flag.name: tab_completion_columns
flag.meaning: Number of columns to use in output for tab completion

flag.name: tab_completion_word
flag.meaning: If non-empty, HandleCommandLineCompletions() will hijack the process and attempt to do bash-style command line flag completion on this value.

flag.name: help
flag.meaning: show help on all flags [tip: all flags can have two dashes]

flag.name: helpfull
flag.meaning: show help on all flags -- same as -help

flag.name: helpmatch
flag.meaning: show help on modules whose name contains the specified substr

flag.name: helpon
flag.meaning: show help on the modules named by this flag value

flag.name: helppackage
flag.meaning: show help on all modules in the main package

flag.name: helpshort
flag.meaning: show help on only the main module for this program

flag.name: helpxml
flag.meaning: produce an xml version of help

flag.name: version
flag.meaning: show version and build info and exit

flag.name: alsologtoemail
flag.meaning: log messages go to these email addresses in addition to logfiles

flag.name: alsologtostderr
flag.meaning: log messages go to stderr in addition to logfiles

flag.name: colorlogtostderr
flag.meaning: color messages logged to stderr (if supported by terminal)

flag.name: drop_log_memory
flag.meaning: Drop in-memory buffers of log contents. Logs can grow very quickly and they are rarely read before they need to be evicted from memory. Instead, drop them from memory as soon as they are flushed to disk.

flag.name: log_backtrace_at
flag.meaning: Emit a backtrace when logging at file:linenum.

flag.name: log_dir
flag.meaning: If specified, logfiles are written into this directory instead of the default logging directory.

flag.name: log_link
flag.meaning: Put additional links to the log files in this directory

flag.name: log_prefix
flag.meaning: Prepend the log prefix to the start of each log line

flag.name: logbuflevel
flag.meaning: Buffer log messages logged at this level or lower (-1 means don't buffer; 0 means buffer INFO only; ...)

flag.name: logbufsecs
flag.meaning: Buffer log messages for at most this many seconds

flag.name: logemaillevel
flag.meaning: Email log messages logged at this level or higher (0 means email all; 3 means email FATAL only; ...)

flag.name: logfile_mode
flag.meaning: Log file mode/permissions.

flag.name: logmailer
flag.meaning: Mailer used to send logging email

flag.name: logtostderr
flag.meaning: log messages go to stderr instead of logfiles

flag.name: max_log_size
flag.meaning: approx. maximum log file size (in MB). A value of 0 will be silently overridden to 1.

flag.name: minloglevel
flag.meaning: Messages logged at a lower level than this don't actually get logged anywhere

flag.name: stderrthreshold
flag.meaning: log messages at or above this level are copied to stderr in addition to logfiles. This flag obsoletes --alsologtostderr.

flag.name: stop_logging_if_full_disk
flag.meaning: Stop attempting to log to disk if the disk is full.

flag.name: symbolize_stacktrace
flag.meaning: Symbolize the stack trace in the tombstone

flag.name: v
flag.meaning: Show all VLOG(m) messages for m <= this. Overridable by --vmodule.

flag.name: vmodule
flag.meaning: per-module verbose level. Argument is a comma-separated list of <module name>=<log level>. <module name> is a glob pattern, matched against the filename base (that is, name ignoring .cc/.h./-inl.h). <log level> overrides any value given by --v.
